loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of gasoline and mobile phone chargers

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 50 years old married, and has three children.  He lives in Bint Jbeil.  Ibrahim has worked in transportation since 2000, specializing in transporting students to and from school and tourist journeys. Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to legally register his van. Ibrahim would like to  buy another van to expand his business

loans.use: To register his van

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en: Zhora V. is married and has one child.  He is engaged in cattle farming.  Zhora has room facilities and cattle food to expand his farm. The family will be growing, and Zhora would like to insure a sufficient income for them. He has applied for a loan to increase the livestock.

loans.use: To increase the livestock

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Angela M. is in her early sixties and is married with seven children. For the past ten years, Angela has been running a general store from which she sells basic goods. The business is open between 05:00 am and 08:00 pm daily and earns Angela a low monthly profit. 

This will be Angela's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Angela used her previous loans to increase her stock of flour and other basic goods. These loans have since been successfully repaid. With her third loan, Angela aims to once again increase her stock, as well as pay school fees for her children. Angela's dream is to one day expand her business to a large store. 

Angela will share this loan with her loan group Haki Sawa, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Angela can be seen as the first on the right.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida P. is a 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Patria, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. Her elder son could not continue his studies in college because of poverty and lack of resources, but she never loses her hopes for her children.  The couple works hard in order to earn money to sustain their basic needs and to have savings for the future of their children.  They wanted both of their children to finish college.  Bienvendia also dreams of having a concrete house, which is separate from her variety store.

Bienvendia has been a member of ASHI for two years.  As a member, she maintains her good performance in repayment and attendance because she does not want ASHI and its field partner to lose their trust in her.

Bienvendia has requested a loan of 20,000.00 PHP, which will be used as a down payment for a motorcycle. This motorcycle will help decrease the family's  expense for transporting their child to school.  It could also give them additional income.  Bienvendia will also invest some of her loan as additional capital for her variety store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 42 years old and married to Ezekiel, a herbalist. They are blessed with five children aged 19, 17, 14, 9 and 4. Anne has been in the tailoring business for the last 12 years, and this earns her 12,000 KES monthly. Now her desire is to venture into selling maize. She is more likely to succeed because her husband is able to cater for their daily expenses with his business profits, thus giving room for Anne to grow and balance her two businesses.
This is her fourth loan from Kiva partner, KADET, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. Anne plans to use her loan to diversify her business by purchasing maize at wholesale prices and selling to consumers at retail prices. She anticipates being able to fully stabilize her business and be in a position to educate her children to higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, onion, tomato etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags rice, gallons of oil etc

loans.name: Mt Kipengele Group

texts.en:
Husna M. is 19 years old and is the single mother of a ten-month-old girl. Three months ago, Husna started her own food vending business to support herself and her child. The business offers ready-made food from 06:00 am until 08:00 pm and earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Husna's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use the loan to increase her stock of certain basic supplies such as rice, flour and cooking oil. By buying this in bulk, she will also be able to get favorable prices. Husna's dream is to one day expand her business into a restaurant and to employ people to help her.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group Mt Kipengele, which totals 21 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Husna can be seen as the first on the right wearing yellow.

loans.use: Increase on food stock

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik S. has been operating “Armenian bazaar” fruit and vegetable market’s restaurant since 2004.  The customers are mainly the market traders, villagers who deliver goods, visitors and  drivers. As this year’s vegetables harvest was low and the prices increasing, Shushanik is planning to purchase large stocks of potatoes, onions, beetroots etc, store them and use them for the restaurant’s needs till the new harvest. Shushanik is forecasting further growth of vegetables prices, and the availability of stock will give her an opportunity not to increase the prices in the restaurant, and tokeep the profit margin on the same level.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables, in bulk

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. is 30 years old and married to Ann. They have one child aged two years. John runs a small general store and a posho mill.He has been making good profits from both businesses and has plans for buying cereals and selling them at a profit.

John learned about Kadet through a friend and with this first loan he wants to buy an additional stock of cereals to ensure that his customers  needs are met especially during the festive season.

John plans to buy a car for taxi services to boost his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cereals

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 27 years old married man father of two children from Bint Jbeil. Hassan has worked as a blacksmith since 2001, He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the necessary machines for his business. Hassan has been dealing  with Al Majmoua since 2006 and is a client in good standing. Hassan is working hard on teaching his children and providing a healthy and secure living situation in addition to providing a joyful life to his family. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy the necessary machines for his business

loans.name: Boris

texts.en: Boris S. has been trading in tires since 2000. He replaces and balances car tires. Boris loves his trade and has permanent customers. Although in Boris’ large family he is not the only person employed, his is the main income that sustains the family. Taking into consideration the increased seasonal demand, Boris has applied for a loan to stock up on tires.

loans.use: To stock up on tires

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 57-year-old married man and a father of five children. He sells sweets and has 40 years of experience in this field. Since 1986 he has also owned a grocery store. Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials for making sweets in his factory. Ali’s sweets are famous in his region, and requested by customers. Ali is happy with what he has achieved and hopes to keep on.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Solomon Azenga

texts.en: Solomon M. is 35 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  For five years, he has been in the business of making new shoes, repairing shoes, and shoe shining.  He also has a farm and sells the produce for additional income.  Solomon is requesting  his first loan from KADET,  which he will use to buy materials for shoe making and shoe shining.  His future plan is to own a shoe shop in town where he will be sell new shoes and employ others to assist him.

loans.use: To purchase shoe making materials

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk B. has been trading in plastic goods since 2008. Realizing that the profit from this activity is very important for his family (where one of his parents is disabled), he does his best to maximize his profits by acquiring goods that are in high demand. Currently, customer demand is for a new, varied stock, for which he needs a loan.

loans.use: To purchase new stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 38-year-old married man and father of five children. He has worked as a car painter for 20 years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy used cars, fix them and trade them in order to increase his income. Ali is happy with his work and seeks perfection at all times. He is working hard to open a big maintenance garage in the future.

loans.use: To buy used cars, fix them and trade them

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine S. started her business in 2001. She trades in flour and grains. Karine is married with 3 children, and lives with her mother-in-law. Karine’s husband helps her in running the business. Their joint efforts have produced great results for years. Now she has some orders and has applied for the loan to purchase packaging and grains.

loans.use: To purchase packaging and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice, beans, pepper, salt, seasoning etc.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: Nelli V. has been trading in clothes since 1998. Nelli’s husband has gone to Russia for work purposes and Nelli is the main caretaker of her two children. Nelli has applied for the loan to purchase pre-holiday season clothing.

loans.use: To purchase pre-holiday season clothing.

loans.name: Rossie Gaudencia

texts.en:
Rossie is a twenty-five year old married lady with three children aged five, four, and two years old. All the children go to school and she has been able to pay the school fees from the profits she makes. She has been in the business of selling vegetables at the centre for three years now.

With this first loan she plans to buy vegetables and small fish commonly known as omena to sell to her customers. Her future plan is to own a shop at the centre to boost her income so that she can educate all her children in good schools.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables and small fish locally known as omena.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 33 year old married man from Saida. He is the father of 3 kids. Ghassan has worked as a house painter for 15 years and is an expert in his field. Ghassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools and machines for his business. He hopes to expand his working region, through opening a construction company with a good number of employees to cover a wider region.

loans.use: To buy new tools.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima H. lives with her husband and son’s family with one child.  The whole family is engaged in cattle farming, and this is the only activity that brings some income to them, following days and nights of hard work. Rima has applied for the loan to buy cattle feed for this winter.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for this winter.

loans.name: Prisca Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Prisca is a forty year old lady married to Korir, and they have three children aged fifteen, twelve and eight years old respectively.

Prisca has been in the business of buying cereals in her area and selling them at a profit. She has been in this business for six years now, and says she has made good profits from it, especially during the harvest seasons.

With this first loan she plans to puchase bags of maize and beans, because the supply is high right now, and then she will transport them to the centre to sell.

She plans to buy a plot at the centre to develop, and to supply cereals to bigger towns where she will get more profits to educate all her children to university levels.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Christelle  Sophalia

texts.fr:
jeune femme de 39 ans,célibataire avec 3 enfants  vendeuse de sacs, cartables, valises, depuis bientôt 5 ans , elle a bénéficie d'un prêt auprès de Hope.A l'octroi de ce prêt elle a renforce son stock en achetant des sacs a main pour hommes et dames ,valises et  cartables et tout ce dont les clients ont besoin et ses ventes se sont élevés de 15.000f a 100.000frs par jour. Son étalage attire les clients , elle a toutes les qualités d'articles.

Elle a rembourse son prêt avec succès et épargne beaucoup d'argent comme jamais elle l'a fait. 

Avec le second prêt elle compte refaire les mêmes choses en achetant en gros certains de ces articles comme les cartables et valises, en faisant des commandes a ceux qui vont en Chine, et tient a arriver au bout de son objectif en vendant mieux et en faisant plus d'épargne.
Tres enthousiaste elle tient aller au bout de ses objectifs en faisant mieux et elle a amélioré les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A 39-year old woman, single with three children, she has been selling handbags, school bags and luggage for almost five years. She had a loan from Hope before. Thanks to this loan she was able to increase her stock purchasing ladies’ and men’s handbags, luggage and backpacks and all items required by her customers. Her sales grew from 15,000 to 100,000 West African francs per day. Her display attracts customers. She offers items in various price ranges. She has repaid her loan successfully and was able to save more money than ever before.

With this second loan, she plans to do the same: purchase wholesale some of her articles such as schoolbags and luggage bags, placing orders with buyers who travel to China. She is set to pursue her goal to increase her sales volume and grow her savings. Very enthusiastic, she is committed to her goals and does her best to improve life conditions for herself and her children.

loans.use: Purchasing travel bags, school bags, suitcases, and handbags

loans.name: Richard Musyoka

texts.en:
Richard Musyoka is an enterprising single man from the County of Migori, along the shores of Lake Victoria, Western Kenya.

Richard operates a bulk clothes selling business in the town of Migori and has operated this business for the last two years with great success, making a monthly profit of Kshs 50,000. He is taking a loan of Kshs 40,000, which he intends to use to buy more clothing in bulk for sale. He is optimistic that he is going to benefit from high sales in the coming festive season. This is his first loan from Kadet Ltd and he wants to maintain a good repayment history so that he can qualify for subsequent loans.

He hopes to expand and bring in more clothing frequently requested by his clientele, because he believes their satisfaction will guarantee him growth.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen S. lives with his wife, mother and two children. He is engaged in cattle farming, which is the only source of income for his household. As winter is aproaching it is vital for the family to sustain its little farm, which requires cattle feed, and with this purpose in mind he has applied to SEF for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi P. has been trading in children’s clothing since 2004. She started her business to support her big family of 5 members. Armenuhi is very much devoted to her work, enjoying working with her little clients and their parents. Having children as clients is doubly demanding, making it necessary to satisfy the children as well as their parents, and this is why Armenuhi tries to keep a good variety of clothing. Armenuhi has applied for the loan to bring exciting new children’s clothing in for the holiday season.

loans.use: To bring in holiday season children's clothing.

loans.name: Basoga Tweyambe-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Fred M. belongs to Basoga Tweyambe group-Jinja. Twelve years is the time he has been operating his retail shop in Jinja Town. He started this business with the influence of a close friend. Prior to this, he was more preoccupied with his farming enterprise that he still runs, albeit on a low key basis. To all appearances, Fred seems a diligent,cooperative and determined gentleman. Close friends say he exhibits a certain courage of conviction that they say at length will most probably see him make much more head way in his operations.

At his retail shop he sells a variety of general merchandise retail items that are popular with most people in the area he operates from. Weekly, he says this business generates him shillings 150,000 as profits, and with this loan he says he is going to procure more general merchandise retail items such as maize flour, rice, beans, etc. to resell. The kids who appear in the photo are children of some of the group members.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise retail items such as maize flour, rice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice Jemutai

texts.en:
Beatrice Jemutai K. is a hardworking lady of 42, married to Albert Koech who is a business man, and together they have three children aged 19, 15 and 10. She has been farming for about four years and she earns a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she has no history with any other MFI. She is applying  for her third loan of Kshs. 25,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy stock of poultry feeds and more poultry so that she may have more eggs to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start pig farming which is also very marketable in the area.

Beatrice hopes to grow her business, become the leading local investor, and to see her children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy stock of poultry feeds and poultry.

loans.name: Ursulla

texts.en:
Ursulla J. is 48 years old, married to Alloysuis Kipkemei who is a farmer and provides additional income for the family. They have five school going children, and they live in Edoret, Kenya. She has been operating a general shop, and has been in this business, for 10 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.20,000.

Ursulla learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her third loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, eight bags of sugar, and other stock needed. The anticipated profits she plans to use to expand the shop business.

In future, Ursulla wishes to have a dairy cow since both businesses have proven to be very profitable in the area. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, and eight bags of sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is a 30 year old mother who always strives hard for the betterment of the family. She is married to Nelson M. and they are blessed with six children, her eldest child is already 15 years old while the youngest is 5 years old. Her husband is very supportive but unfortunately, his income is unstable and that is why their eldest did not continue her studies in high school.

Last year she joined ASHI because she believed that only ASHI could help her to achieve her dreams. After short orientation/training, she got her first loan Php.5,000.00 and after 6 months she successfully paid the said amount. She has also shown worthiness and that is why she was granted with a loan of a bigger amount.

Presently, she buys and sells rice in their town. Their income from this business really helps her to cater for the needs of the family. But their income is always based on their capital that they investment, and according to her “the bigger the investment; the greater the income”, and that is why she is proposing Php.12,000.00 for her next loan so that she will have more capital.

Her greatest dream in life is that their children will finish their studies until college so that they will have good jobs, and she also aspires of building a concrete house someday through their income from the loans that they borrowed from ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 44, married to Jane Wanjiru, and they have two children. Peter and his spouse operate the green grocer shop together and this has been Peter’s business for four years. 

Due to the fact that Peter has successfully repaid three loans with KADET LTD, he is one of the clients who has maintained a good credit history with KADET LTD. He has applied for his fourth loan, which he plans to use to buy 10 bags of potatoes, five bags of cabbages, two cartons of coriander, three bags of carrots, and five crates of tomatoes, all worth 80,000 shillings. He looks forward to being the supplier of the above named product to all small scale sellers in Zambezi area.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the green grocery business.

loans.name: Kosiom Ole

texts.en:
Kosiom Ole T. is 41 years old. He is married to Naropill T. and he is a father of five school going children. 

Kosiom is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend the loan to prepare land for the next planting season and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize output and some part of the profit to develop his plot.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, whereby he can plant more maize on a larger scale. Kosiom believes he is hard working and by having the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for the next planting season by buying chemicals and fertilizer for his maize plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, corn

loans.name: Wabulungu Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en:
An alcohol sales business is what 42 year old Betty I. has been operating for the last 10 years in Magamaga-Jinja. It is a business this happily married mother of 11 says she began with her own enterprise. Previously, she worked in a cement factory. It was an experience she says she did not fancy that much owing to the low remuneration she was paid yet she put in a lot. Farming was another activity she had a hand in though with time and with reflection, she decided to dispense with.

She mostly sells a local brew popularly known as Waragi which is quite popular with many low rank and file people in Ugandan urban centers. All her kids have been getting an education out of the hard work and effort she has put in in her business. Weekly this business generates her shillings 160,000. With this loan, Betty, who is affliated with Wabulungu Women's group-Jinja, says she is going to buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol for resale and also pay fees for some of her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more crude alcohol for resale and to pay fees for some of her kids.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Siloe Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO  SILOE
MARTA X. S..
De 51 años de edad tiene seis hijos tres casados y tres solteros que son los que la apoyan en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de suéteres y blusas, su venta lo realiza en diferentes pueblos de ambulante, ella también elabora güipiles a mano pero su actividad principal es la venta de suéteres, ella tiene una visión de agrandar mas su negocio, y comprar mas mercadería para poder surtir mejor su producto, pero para que pueda hacerlo necesita su crédito. Para compra de ropa.
MARIA LIDIA X. S..
De 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos pequeños, tiene una hija mas grandecita que la ayuda a atender su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebe, su negocio lo tiene en Comalapa, ella también se dedica al alquiler de sillas y mesas, pero donde va a invertir su crédito  en su venta de ropa de bebe, ella quiere surtir su tienda con diferentes estilos y por esa razón  solicita su crédito para compra de ropa de bebe y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
SILOE GROUP
51-year old Marta X. S. has six children, three of whom are married and three single. The latter help her with her business selling sweaters and blouses in the streets of different towns. Marta also makes güipiles (traditional weavings) by hand, but her main work is selling sweaters. She would like to expand her business and buy more merchandise to sell, but for this she needs a loan to buy clothing.

41-year old Maria X. S. has four young children and one older daughter who helps her with her business selling baby clothes in the town of Comalapa. Maria also rents out chairs and tables, but she plans to use the loan to buy baby clothes. She wants to stock her store with different styles of baby outfits and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing and sweaters

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in the Busega neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, four of whom are in school. Kasifa   has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Kasifa sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Kasifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil, and boxes of exercise books and pens. The main business challenges for Kasifa include seasonality and thieves.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only. Kasifa lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, exercise books and pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron to continue with her welding work

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron N. lives in the Naguru neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 10 children, six of whom are in school.  Eron has a business of second hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Eron sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Eron has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Eron include seasonality and thieves.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand clothes herself and also to be a wholesaler. Eron lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: RAMIRO C.   es casado,  tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos  todos mayores de edad los cuales trabajan por su cuenta. Ramiro inicio su negocio hace 22 años cuando el y su esposa  iniciaron su negocio   con un pequeño ahorro lo invirtió  en la  compra cortinas colchas vajilla y, el agradece primeramente a Dios y Fape que le puedan brindar la oportunidad en darle un crédito  e invertirlo en mas mercadería de usos domesticos   y   poder trabajar  con su familia y tener un mejor futuro. El sueño que él  tiene es poder comprarle  a cada uno de sus hijos un terreno.
texts.en:
Ramiro C., age 55, is married and has three grown children who work for a living. Ramiro began his business 22 years ago when he and his wife started with a little savings and invested it in the purchase of curtains, bedspreads, and tableware.

It is thanks primarily to God and FAPE that they were able to be offered the opportunity it to obtain a loan, invest it in more merchandise for domestic uses, and be able to work with their family for a better future. His dream is to be able to buy land for each if his children.

loans.use: Purchase of products for domestic uses.

loans.name: Ludita

texts.en:
A strong and determined woman, Ludita A., 52 years old, is from Botbot, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. She is married to a very industrious and supportive farmer, Rodrigo A.. As the fruit of their love, they are blessed with four children. Their eldest child is already 19 years old, while the youngest is only 10 years old. Due to poverty, their eldest child has not finished his studies even in high school, and that is the reason why they really strive hard in order to give a bright future for their children. 

They earn their income through farming and hog fattening. Since farming is seasonal, sometimes it happens that their income cannot sustain their basic needs. They are trying their best to maintain her very good performance as a member of ASHI, because she wants to propose a bigger loan in order that to earn a much bigger income which can sustain the basic needs of the family, especially the education of their children.

As of now, she has already fully paid her last loan and presently is applying for a loan of Php.14,000.00. This amount will be used to purchase some farm inputs and piglets for her hog fattening project. This business helps them a lot to sustain their basic needs.

Ludita dreams that their children will finish their studies so that they will get great jobs. She wishes that through their industry, they will become financially stable.

loans.use: Farm Inputs/Hog Fattening.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Recorriendo las calles de su distrito, Rosa vende cosméticos las marcas muy reconocidas en el mercado. Es así que luego de sus labores domésticas, visita a sus familiares, amigas y vecinas de su barrio, a quienes vende éstos productos de belleza, aprovechando las ofertas que se presentan. Lleva más de 10 años trabajando de esta manera y por tal se siente muy satisfecha por las buenas utilidades que le deja y; mas aún cuando sus clientes le pagan a tiempo.  En adelante,  piensa instalar un bazar en un mercado de su distrito ó de lo contrario en su casa, para mejorar diversificar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, ya que su fin es darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es su 17avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy centrada en sus opiniones y como tal la respetan. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más productos de belleza, para cumplir pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old.  She is a very hard-working mother who lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children.  Rosa sells very well-known brands of cosmetics throughout the streets of her district.  After finishing her housework, she visits her family members, friends and neighbors to whom she sells these beauty products, taking advantage of offers.  She has been working in this way for more than 10 years and she feels very satisfied with the good profits that she makes.  She feels even more satisfied when her customers pay on time.

In the future Rosa plans to set up a stall in a market in her district or in her home so that she can improve and diversify her sales and increase her profits since her goal is to provide her children with a better quality of life.

This is Rosa's 17th loan from MFP.  She knows that she has to make her repayments on time and she is ready to do this.  In her community bank, she is a member who is very balanced in her opinions and, as such, her fellow members respect her.  She will use her loan to buy more beauty products to fill some orders which she has outstanding.

loans.use: To acquire more beauty products so that she can fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Marie Cecile

texts.fr: Cécile a 52 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien de profession. Elle a en charge 4 enfants. Pour arriver à participer au foyer, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits d'alimentations générale et articles de mercerie.  Son Etablissement sis à Bè-Kpota où elle habite en même temps. A travers cette activité, elle a eu des prêts qui ont été remboursés.  Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un crédit pour faire augmenter son commerce.
texts.en: Cécile is 52 years old and is married to a mechanic.  She has 4 children in her care. In order to contribute to household expenses, she has a business selling general food products and sewing notions. Her enterprise is located at Bè-Kpota where she also lives. She has had loans for this business that have been repaid.   She is requesting a loan from WAGES to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food products and sewing notions

loans.name: Pedro Klever

texts.es:
Pedro Klever B. A. tiene 50 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN MIGUELITO se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja . Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas para los cultivos y abonos y fertilizantes para las semillas cultivadas, platano, naranja, mangos y naranja. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

Le gusta pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro Klever B. A. is 50 years old. He lives in Unión Libre in the canton of Chillanes, Bolívar Province, with his partner and their children. He has 3 children.

The members of the San Miguelito Cooperative Rural Bank are located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office (of Cooperativa San Jose) in Chillanes canton. The members of this rural bank are dedicated to short cycle farming, planting, corn, bananas, oranges, and mangos. They have been in this business a long time.

Pedro is engaged in farming and planting corn, bananas, oranges, and mangos. He purchases products he needs in Matilde Esther and sells his crops in the market in Chillanes, in the same area.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase seed for his crops and fertilizer for the cultivation of bananas, oranges, and mangos. The loan will help him meet his economic needs.

He confronts challenges such as pests, diseases, and changes in climate. His dream is to continue working for the education of his children. He likes spending time with his children.

loans.use: Seed for his crops and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 54 años, enviudo hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos y su nieto Fabricio. Hace más de 12 años viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa y vasijas de plástico, ya que su principal prioridad era sacar adelante a sus hijos y lo logró. Hoy en día, sus hijos  son hombres de bien y la apoyan cubriendo los gastos de la casa. Además ya no derrocha muchas energías como antes, cargando sus bolsos pesados bajo el hombro, ahora solo atiende los pedidos que le hicieran sus clientes, así tiene más horas libres para cuidar de su nieto, quien es su adoración. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que le genera ganancias que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos que necesita para su hogar. En adelante, anhela tener su negocio en su propia casa, de ese modo puede tener un vida mucho más tranquila. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará prendas de vestir para el verano, de esa manera podrá incrementar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 54, widowed for many years, and lives in her own house with her 3 children and her grandson Fabricio.  For more than 12 years she has dedicated herself to selling clothes and plastic glasses, and her principal goal has been to advance her children.  She has succeeded.  Today, her sons are grown men and they help her cover household expenses.  Moreover, she no longer expends as much energy as before lugging heavy bags hanging from her shoulders.  Now, she just has to attend to the orders of her customers.  Thus, she has more free hours to care for her grandchild, who is her pride and joy.

What she likes best about her business is that it generates earnings that help to cover the costs  of necessities for her home.  In the future, she hopes to have her business in her own home so that she can have a much more tranquil life.

This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time, she will have access to others with greater confidence, and without creating complications for her communal group.  With this loan, she will buy summer clothing and, in this manner, increment her stock of products.

loans.use: TO BUY SUMMER CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth B. lives in the Kitawuluzi Lubaga Road neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Ruth's retail business sells sweet bananas. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days a week. Ruth sells her products at the market. She generates additional income through selling piped water. Ruth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Ruth has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start to going to Masaka villages for sweet bananas. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seeds and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Koffi Nicola

texts.fr: Nicolas a 32 ans  et a en charge 3 ans. IL est marié à une coiffeuse de profession.  Il est né à Lomé et habite Nukafu où il a son atelier.  Pour s'occuper de ma famille, il exerce le mécanique et a associé la vente de pièces détachées. Il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite dans son atelier.Il cumule dans cette activité 5 ans déjà. IL sollicite un nouveau crédit pour augmenter son commerce
texts.en: Nicolas is 32 years and has a 3 year-old in his care. He is married to a hairdresser. He was born in Lomé and lives in Nukafu where he has his workshop. He works as a mechanic and also sells spare parts to support his family. He gets his supplies at the Lomé Grand Market and then sells them in his workshop.  He has operated this business for 5 years. He is requesting a new loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años, es madre soltera y una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo Manuel de 16 años. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en diversos oficios, para brindar la mejor educación a su hijo, quien es su mayor inspiración. Desde entonces vende hamburguesas en la puerta de su casa; solo por las tardes hasta altas horas de la noche, en la que también su hijo la ayuda. Asimismo, en horas de la mañana vende productos de belleza, negocio que le va muy bien, ya que los ofrece a sus asiduos clientes, quienes acuden a su pequeño puesto de comida. Se siente satisfecha de realizar ambos trabajos, disfrutando mucho la interrelación con sus clientes. En  adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio con la venta de almuerzos, de ese modo dinamizar sus ingresos. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso  para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Además de ser un socio de su grupo comunal, le gusta apoyar en la organización de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mesas, sillas  y accesorios de cocina, de ese modo emprenderá el negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en: Maria, 36, is an enterprising single mother who lives in her own home along with her son Manuel, who is 16 years old.  From a very early age she has worked in a number of occupations to provide the best education for her son, who is her main motivation.  She sells hamburgers from a door in her house from the afternoons until late in the evening, when her son also helps her.  In addition, in the morning hours she sells beauty products, a business that is going very well, since she offers these products to the regular customers who come to her food stand.  She feels content doing both of these jobs, because she very much enjoys interacting with her customers.  In the future, she will expand her business to include the sale of lunches and thereby boost her income.  This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she knows that the loan that she will receive will be very beneficial for the development of her businesses.  In addition to being a member of her communal group, she enjoys supporting the organization of her group.  With the loan that she requests, she will buy tables, chairs and kitchen accessories

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to start selling lunches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 1, 2 & 3 (Going Forward). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She operates a cybercafe with photocopying, computers, Internet, scanning and other services. 

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, which she started with her own capital after saving for a while. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing some hardware, repairing some computers, and adding an scanner. She will use the profits to expand her business by adding telecommunications products. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and to help her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook for her family.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she heard it was a good program where she could get a loan to expand her business, and her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry; the main economic activities are a free trade zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy hardware and fix computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Domiga Del Rosario

texts.es: Dominga Del Rosario C.  R.  tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez y vive con sus 4 hijos de 19,15 ,9 y 8 años de edad los cuales estudian en escuela de gobierno y un nieto de 3 años.  Ella desde pequeña desempeño el trabajo de guagera del relleno sanitario, recogiendo desechos para reciclar, desde hace 10 años ya no realiza esa labor debido a que una trabajadora social la invito a una fundación para que aprendiera manualidades, le gusto y luego se intereso por aprender a hacer cortes de cabello (curso de belleza)  y  a confeccionar cortina, sabanas, sobre fundas (curso de Blancos) también se intereso por un curso de informática. Ella esta muy satisfecha y quiere  seguir aprendiendo mas cosas para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sean profesionales, ya que ese es uno de sus sueños,  y en  esta oportunidad solicita un crédito Kiva, por medio de FAPE, para poder invertir en la Confección de sabana, cortinas especialmente en esta época del año,  donde se obtienen mejores ganancias y poder mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y la  de sus hijos.
texts.en: Dominga Del Rosario C. R. is 37 years old.  She is a single mother as she was widowed.  She lives with her 4 childR. who are 19, 18, 9, and 9 years old and who are studying in a government school, and with a 3 year old grandson.  Since she was little, she worked hard as the keeper of a landfill, where she recovered waste for recycling.  10 years ago she stopped doing this work thanks to a fellow worker who invited her to a foundation in order to learn a trade.  She liked it, and later she become interested in learning how to do haircuts (beauty school) and to make curtains, sheets, covers (a course in white goods), and also she was interested in a technology course.  She is very happy and wants to continue learning more things in order to be able to move ahead in life for her childR., so that they might become professionals.  This is already one of their dreams, and for this opportunity she is asking for a Kiva loan via FAPE, in order to be able to invest in making sheets, special curtains for this time of year, so she can obtain better earnings and be able to improve quality of life for herself and her childR..

loans.use: To make sheets and seasonal curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 40 años,  en una madre de familia muy trabajadora y preocupada por el desarrollo de su barrio, vive en su casa,  propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores. La actividad cotidiana al que se dedica Elizabeth, es la preparación de papa y pollo fritos, comúnmente llamado (salchipapas), platillos que vender al igual que las gaseosas. Desde entonces su trabajo consiste en pelar la papa la cantidad de 6 a 8 kilos diariamente, para tenerlas lista para la fritura; además de sazonar el pollo. De esta manera lleva más de 7 años realizando esta labor, en la puerta de su casa,  siendo sus clientes sus vecinos de su barrio, quienes gustan de su sazón y de la atención. Para Elizabeth es muy importante éste trabajo, ya que se genera ingresos para su familia, por tanto procura siempre ser cordial con sus clientes. En adelante, continuará trabajando con su negocio para construir su casa, de ese modo mejorará su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Es su primer crédito que tiene Elizabeth, y hace compromiso de pagar puntual sus cuotas. Desea asimismo contribuir por el bienestar y organización de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos para la elaboración de comida rápida, de ese modo seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years old.  She is the mother of a very hardworking family, and is concerned with the development of her  neighborhood.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their three small children.  The daily activity that Elizabeth works at is the preparation of potatoes and and fried chicken, commonly called salchipapas, plates that  she sells along with soda pops.  Typically, her work consists of peeling potatoes in the quantity of 6 to 8 kilograms daily in order to have them ready for the  food stall; also she seasons the chicken.  In this way she has spent more than 7 years doing this work in the door of her home.  Her clients are her neighbors in the neighborhood, who like her seasonings and the attention.  For Elizabeth this work is very important, as it generates income for her family.  As such she tries to always be pleasant with her clients.  In the future, she will continue working wit her business in order to construct her house, and in this way she will improve her quality of life and that of her children.  This is the first loan that Elizabeth has taken, and she has promised to make her payments punctually.  She also wants to contribute to the wellbeing and organization of her communal group.  With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy ingredients to make fast food, and in this way continue to attend to her clients.

loans.use: To buy non-perishable products to make fast food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Marsel

texts.es: Marsel tiene 34 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Marsel, con su bolso bajo el hombro, recorre las calles de su distrito, vendiendo sus prendas para niños, señoritas y personas adultas; cumpliendo con los pedidos que le hacen. Es así que sube y baja los cerros empinados de su distrito, ya que en ese lugar viven la mayoría de sus clientes, dejándoles a precios un poco más elevados, siendo vendidos a crédito la mercadería que lleva, y cuando transcurre un tiempo, realiza las cobranzas, aprovechar para ofrecer otras nuevas prendas. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y menciona que el es muy rentable, ya que le gusta ser muy cumplida en la entrega de sus pedidos, de esa manera no pierde la confianza que depositaron sus clientes en ella. Por lo pronto continuará con la construcción de su casa para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su 2do crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, para contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más prendas de vestir y así incrementará su stock de ropa para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Marsel is 34 years old and a hard working wife and mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 2 children. Marsel, with her bag on her shoulder, travels the streets of her districts selling clothing for children, young women and adults. She fills orders that people make with her.  Thus she goes up and down the steep hills of her district, since that is where most of her customers live.  She charges them a little more because she sells the merchandise to them on credit. After time, she makes her collections and offers them more articles of clothing.  He has had this business for 3 years and she reports that it is very profitable, since she likes to be very punctual when delivering orders. That way she doesn't lose the trust her customers have put in her. In the meantime, she will continue with the construction of her home to offer her family a better quality of life. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she is committed making her payments on time, to be able to count on help later. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy more articles of clothing and in this way increase her clothing stock for the summer season.

loans.use: To acquire more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for the crops.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florida Q. S. D. J. , es casada tiene 26 años D. edad y tiene dos hijos pequeños su esposo trabaja como jornalero albañil por su cuenta, y ayuda con los gastos D. su casa y paga las colegiaturas D. sus hijos. Florida se dedica a vender productos comestibles por mayor, como frijol, maiz, etc. En el mercado municipal  empezó con du negocio desD. el 15 D. enero del 2007   con un  crédito que obtuvo en Fape D. 1500, compro 3 quintales D. frijol,  a la fecha compro hasta 14 quintales a la semana y espera que con el nuevo crédito que solicita pueda comprar mas y variar su negocio y poder seguir ayudando al aporte económico D. hogar.
texts.en: Florida Q. S. D. J. is 26 years old, married and has two small children.  Her husband works as a self-employed mason laborer and helps with the household expenses and their children's education expenses.  Florida sells grocery products wholesale such as beans, corn, etc.  She started her business on January 15, 2007 at the market in her town with a loan from FAPE for 1500.  She bought 3 quintals (1quintal = 100lbs.) of beans and now buys up to 14 quintals a week.  She hopes that with this new loan she can buy more products, diversify her business and continue supporting her household.

loans.use: To purchase quintals of beans and corn

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz; ella tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía como pantalones,gorros ,polos guantes,chalinas entre otros más ,la socia a la vez tiene su negocio de cambio de dólares ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo , esta es la forma de sacar adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz, 27, is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” (United for Success) communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and one son.  She alternates her daily chores with a crafts business: pants, caps, sweatshirts, gloves, scarves, among others.  She also has a dollar exchange business.  She works together with her husband and this is the way the family gets ahead in life.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her business.

She thanks those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Luís Misael

texts.es:
Luís Misael S. V. tiene 35 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho además es chofer profesional. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir incrementando los cultivos para dar mejor futuro al hijo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Misael S. V., 35, is married and lives with his wife and son in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has one son.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  They belong to Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming chores and other professional chores.  It has 17 members.

Luís is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer; he’s also a professional chauffeur.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells at the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for the loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to increase his crops to provide a better future for his son.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia, de 41 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica Leoncia, es la venta de comida, en un mercado populoso de su barrio, que se encuentra a 10 minutos de su casa. Sus clientes son los comerciantes que trabajan en dicho mercado, quienes no dudan en comprarle sus deliciosos paltillos, por lo que termina de vender todo lo que prepara, y le va muy  bien. Es así, que viene trabajando hace 3 años en esta labor y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación con sus clientes con quienes se siente entretiene, además que le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar los gastos de su hogar. Su plan futuro es construir su casa, asimismo desea mas adelante cambiar de rubro, y vender ropa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere defraudar la invitación que le hicieron, los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará productos comestibles como: arroz, fideos y aceite al por mayor, para tener su stock de mercadería, de ese modo continuará trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Leoncia, 41, is a hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  Her business is food sales in a crowded market in her neighborhood that is located ten minutes from home.

Her customers are merchants that work in said market who don’t hesitate to buy her tasty dishes.  She, therefore, sells out everything she prepares.  She does very well.

She has been working like this for the past three years.  What she most enjoys about the work is communicating with her customers because she amuses herself that way.  Besides, it generates good economic profits that allow her to help meet household expenses.

Her plan for the future is to build her house.  She’d also like to go into a new line of work: selling clothes.

This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being punctual with her repayments because she does not want to disappoint the members of the communal bank that invited her.

She will use the requested funds to buy edible products like: rice, noodles and cooking oil at wholesale to have in stock so that she can continue working in her business.

loans.use: To buy products like: rice, noodles and oil at wholesale to continue with her food sales.

loans.name: Maria Bety

texts.es:
Maria Bety P. R. tiene 32 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con el hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es terminar de construir la casa para el futuro de mi hijo.

Le gusta leer con el hijo.
texts.en:
María Bety P. R., 32, is married and lives with her husband and son in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has one son.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional activities.  It has 17 members.

 María is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her own settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs. They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and variability in the weather.  Her dream is to finish building her house for her son’s future.

She enjoys reading with her son.

loans.use: For seed and manure.

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA ELTRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Judit; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio técnico para todo tipo de electrodomésticos,la socia tiene su local por el centro de la ciudad el cual  trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas repuestos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judit, 42, is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” (United for Success) communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a technical service business for all kinds of home appliances.  Her shop is located around downtown and she operates it with her husband.  She is a very enterprising person with a strong desire to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy more replacement parts for the business.

She thanks those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.en:
Guisselle M. L. is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in Caballo Blanco, Cartago, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Guisselle has a business producing handmade woven garments including sweaters, toques, gloves, scarves, socks, etc. She also offers decorating services for special events such as birthdays, communions, and work parties. Her main source of revenue is her garment business, but she involves herself with both activities in order to maintain a steady stream of income. Guisselle has been working in this capacity for the past eight years.  Her revenue generating activities have helped her to provide for her children.

This will be Guisselle's first loan with Fundación Mujer. Guisselle decided to apply for a loan after completing a capacity building course in business administration at the Foundation.  With this loan, Guisselle plans to make investments in both of her productive activities. Specifically, she plans to buy different colors of high quality wool and make repairs to her weaving machine by replacing the cones.  She also plans to use the loan to purchase balloons and party decorations. Currently Guiselle has pending orders in both of her activities.  She lacks sufficient working capital in order to make investments, which would enable her to satisfy the demands of her clients. This loan will help to address this obstacle. 

With two children and a home to take care of, Guisselle is busy most days until 3 PM. She dedicates the hours between 3 and 6 to weaving. If necessary, she will weave after dinner until 11 PM.  When she provides party decoration services, her husband assists her.  Guisselle´s long-term goal is to fulfill her business plan, which includes generating sufficient revenues from her productive activities in order to open a weaving workshop and a gift shop. As mentioned, the main factor inhibiting the growth of her business is a lack of access to working capital. Guisselle plans to use this loan to make bulk purchases of quality raw materials, which will ensure a better price from her suppliers and lower her overall costs of production.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and party decorations and to repair equipment

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa Q., es casada tiene 28 años de edad y dos hijos los que aun estudia, su esposo trabaja por su propia cuenta vendiendo verduras, le ayuda  con los gastos de su casa. Josefa vende artesanias  como ropa  típica cortes, Güipiles y blusas. Empezó  a vender en el mercado durante tres meses luego se traslado al mercado municipal de su localidad  su sueño es poner su negocio en un local ya que vende afuera del mercado y poder contar con los mismos ingresos para ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos, desea ahora trabajar con un crédito individual y espera se le dé la oportunidad.
texts.en: Josefa Q. is 28, married, and has two children who are in school.  Her husband works on his own selling vegetables and she helps him with the household expenses.  Josefa sells handicrafts such as typical clothing, dresses, huipiles (traditional native embroidered tunics) and blouses.  She started selling at the market three months ago and then switched to the municipal market in her town.  Her dream is to have a stand for her business now that she sells away from the market and to be able to count on the same earnings to help her husband and children.  She hopes to have her own loan and is waiting for the opportunity.

loans.use: Sale of handicrafts, such as various types of typical clothing

loans.name: Gabriel Mateo

texts.es:
Gabriel Mateo A. Q. tiene 50 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho además tiene gallinas de crianza. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas tierras para seguir cultivando.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Gabriel Mateo A. Q., 50, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has four children.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Gabriel is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer; he also raises chickens.  He buys his supplies in Chillanes and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his settlement.

He is asking for a loan to buy maize, broad bean, pea and chayote seed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like illnesses, infestations and weather changes.  His dream is to have more land to continue farming.

He enjoys watching television.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Rubis Luisa

texts.es:
Rubis de 41 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Para poder tener un medio de trabajo y  mantener a sus hijos ella invirtió sus ahorros en víveres de primera necesidad y los comenzó a vender a sus conocidos y amigos en la parte delantera de su casa donde la readecuo para tener una pequeña tienda. Ubico la tienda en la  parte delantera de la casa y comenzó a trabajar desde muy temprano para generar dinero. En la actualidad  trabaja  vendiendo snack, arroz, carnes, bebidas, harina etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio y que le genere más ingresos ella quiere surtir mas la tienda comprando con el préstamo harina, huevos, arroz, bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener terminar de construir su casa ya que es de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Rubís, 41, has a small grocery store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a periurban area called Fortín de la Flor, a hilly area noted for its unpaved streets.

In order to have a source of work and to support her children she invested her savings in basic need foodstuffs and started selling them to her acquaintances and friends in the front part of her house that she equipped as a small store.  She located the store in the front part of her house and started working from very early to earn money.  She currently works selling snacks, rice, meats, beverages, flour, etc.

To stay in business and generate more income she wants to stock the store better and will use the loan to buy flour, eggs, rice and beverages.  In the future she wants to finish building her house since it’s currently made of bricks.

loans.use: For flour, eggs and rice.

loans.name: Edgar Mentor

texts.es:
Edgar Mentor B. L. tiene 31 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Edgar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la mejor educación a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Edgar Mentor B. L. is 31 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Edgar is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Edgar is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to provide his children with the best education possible.

Edgar likes going out for walks with his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose; el tiene 53 años de edad y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación de velas,el socio lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento,el socio se siente contento con su negocio y se prepara para fabricar mas velas ya que se acerca las fiestas navideñas.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como (parafina)  para la fabricación de velas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
José, 53, is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” (United for Success) communal bank which is located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single.  He alternates his daily chores with candle making.  He has been in this business for years and it’s the only activity he’s involved with at present.  He is happy with his business and is getting ready to make more candles because the Christmas season is approaching.

He is asking for the loan to buy candle making raw materials like paraffin.

He thanks those people who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy candle making raw materials like paraffin.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Luis is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 4 & 5 (Going Forward). He makes his home in a simple structure with his son and some other family members. Luis operates a 'colmado,' a store where customers can find all the ingredients to make their daily food; normally, there are colmados within a short walking distance from any home in every neighborhood.

Luis is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his colmado for nine years, which he started with some savings. He is planning to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing rice, beans, canned food, sugar and flour. He will use the profits to invest his business and improve it. He says that his most difficult challenge was working hard after he had an accident and broke a leg. He plans to continue playing dominoes in his free time.

This Esperanza associate began with us because he needed capital for his business and some neighbors invited him to join the group. His story is generally representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). The group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and its sugar cane industry. The main economic activity is a free traD. zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. 

The man standing with the blue shirt is representing his wife, Miguelina, a member of the group who could not attend the meeting.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar and  flour

loans.name: Crelia Gabriela

texts.es:
Crelia Gabriela V. S. tiene 55 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Crelia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es terminar la casa y estar junto a la familia en caso de enfermedad.

Le gusta pasear con la familia los domingos.
texts.en:
Crelia Gabriela V. S. is 55 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. They live in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has 8 children.

The LUZ Y PROGRESO ("Light and Progress") loan group is located 20 minutes away from the Chillanes office, in the canton of Chillanes. The office focuses on farming and other professional activities and has a total of 17 members. Crelia works in agriculture. She grows corn, beans, peas and lupin. She buys the goods in Chillanes and sells them at the Chillanes fair and on the premises. 

She request the loan to buy corn, beans, peas and lupin. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. They face challenges such as pests, diseases and the changes in the weather. Her dream is to finish her house and be with her family in case of illness. She enjoys going for walks with her family on Sundays.

loans.use: Seeds

loans.name: José Gabriel

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una vivienda en Chillanes y dar la educación a los hijos.


Le gusta practicar toda clase de deporte.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) members are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional activities.  It has 17 members.

José is a maize, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  He buys his supplies in Chillanes and sells his products in the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to have a house in Chillanes and to provide an education for his children.

He enjoys playing all kinds of sports.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

She enjoys house cleaning.

Rosa Amelia N. H. tiene 33 años. Es soltera, vive con la madre, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia para ponerse un negocio familiar.

The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to the Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Rosa is a corn, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her home settlement.

She enjoys cleaning and straightening up her house and celebrating Carnival.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Marina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas terrenos para que los hijos sigan cultivando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Marina Dolores A. A., 32, is married living with her husband and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has four children.
