The members of the LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light & Progress) communal bank are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It belongs to the Chillanes canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and other professional jobs.  It has 17 members.

Marina is a corn, broad bean, pea and chayote farmer.  She buys her supplies in Chillanes and sells her products in the Chillanes market and in her home settlement.

She is asking for the loan to buy corn, broad bean, pea and chayote seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to have more farmland so that her children can cultivate.

She enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: For seeds.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina vive en la ciudad de Bogotá y se dedica al negocio de telecomunicaciones mediante cabinas telefónicas, sistemas de comunicación por internet, refresquería y venta de los deliciosos dulces Bogotanos y mecatos. Aunque ella tiene  29 años  es una emprendedora y disciplinada mujer,  que inició esta actividad cuando aun tenia 24, le ha ido muy bien porque ha logrado estabilizar su negocio y poco a poco se ha ampliado, porque este es  su principal sueño y para ello quiere gradualmente  ir introduciendo diversidad de productos como el café y derivados de la harina de trigo, así mismo trabajar persistentemente para tener su casa propia y adecuar sucursales en sitios estratégicos en esta ciudad capital. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará un nuevo computador, ampliará las cabinas telefónicas y diversificará su oferta preparando el delicioso café de Colombia, al cual  agregará también deditos empanaditas y diversidad de productos pasabocas. Sus principal desafío son las vías en construcción que la obligan a promover su oferta con mas intensidad y a perfeccionar su servicios  por eso ha adicionado como valor agregado el domicilio. Para Carolina su sitio de trabajo es muy importante y por eso maneja una imagen personal y profesional apropiada acompañada de una infraestructura que por su higiene y limpieza atrae cada día nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina lives in the city of Bogotá and has a telecommunications business consisting of phone booths, Internet access services, snack sales, sale of candies typical of Bogotá and mecatos (coffee based candy).

Although she’s just 29 years old she has done well because she’s an enterprising, disciplined woman.   She started the business when she was 24 and has done well because she’s managed to stabilize the business and gradually has grown.   This is her main dream and she’d like to gradually add products like coffee and items derived from wheat flour.  She also wants to work hard in order to have her own house and branches of her business in various strategic locations in our capital city.

This is the first loan she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy a new computer, to enlarge the phone booths and to diversify her stock inventory items preparing delicious Colombian coffee to which she will also include deditos (cookies), empanaditas (turnovers) and a wide selection of finger food.

Her main challenges are the streets that are under construction which forces her to promote her offer more intensely and to perfect her services; this is why she’s included the address as value added. 

For Carolina her work site is very important and this is why she maintains an appropriate personal and professional appearance accompanied by a clean and hygienic infrastructure to attract new customers every day.

loans.use: To buy a new computer, expand the phone booths and diversify her stock inventory.

loans.name: Milton Klay

texts.es:
Milton de 43 años, tiene un puesto de venta de películas y música. Vive en una casa de caña con su esposa y dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona periurbana. 

Para poder mantener a su familia él comenzó vendiendo películas en VHS hace varios años atrás en un puesto pero como no le generaba mucho dinero consiguió trabajo en un lugar de venta y alquiler de películas.  Cuando tuvo suficiente capital para comprar Cd ubico un pequeño negocio de películas y música en la parte delantera de su casa y así pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Ahora trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de su suegro, vende películas y cd de música variadas. 

Con el préstamo quiere readecuar el lugar donde vende los cd comprando cemento, bloque s y cd para tener más variedad en las películas. En el futuro quiere construir su casa y readecuar su negocio con varias vitrinas.
texts.en:
Milton is 43 years old and has a stall that sells movies and music.  He lives in a house made of cane with his wife and two children who study in a public school located in the outskirts of Guayaquil in a periurban area.

To support his family he began selling VHS tapes a few years ago, but he wasn't able to earn much money, so he got a job selling and renting movies.  When he had enough money to purchase merchandise, he opened a small music and movie store in the front part of his home to be able to spend more time with his children.  Now he works with his father-in-law, starting early in the morning, to sell a variety of movies and music CDs.

With this loan, he would like to improve his store by purchasing cement blocks and more discs to have a larger variety of movies.  In the future, he would like to build a better home and improve his business by adding windows.

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks, music CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Lizardo Baudillo

texts.es:
Lizardo Baudillo Q. C.  tiene 48 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Lizardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte conocer gente y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Lizardo Baudillo Q. C. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and six children in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The members of the V.R.C Luz y Progreso [Light and Progress] are located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office in the canton of Chillanes.  The group is made up of farmers and other laborers.  It has 17 members.

Lizardo is a farmer who plants corn, beans, peas, and lupini beans.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in the market in Chillanes and in his area. 

He is asking for this loan to purchase corn, bean, peas, and lupini bean seeds.  With the support of this loan, he will be able to meet his financial needs.  He can meet challenges like plagues, sicknesses, and weather changes.  His dream is to continue working and send his children to school.

He likes to play sports, meet people, and celebrate holidays.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for his corn, bean, pea, and lupini bean crops

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
HISTORIAS KIVA

Ana Patricia T., tiene 28  años de edad es casada. Tiene 2 hijos los dos van a la escuela, Patricia trabaja en la elaboración de trajes de pantz y trajes formales para uniformes escolares y sweteres etc.
Los trajes que hace lo entrega en las escuelas, y en diferentes instituciones. 
Tiene 6  años de estar trabajando con esta actividad, patricia solicita este crédito a KIVA, para invertir en compra de telas para empezar a  elaborar los trajes para el otro ciclo escolar.
El sueño de Patricia es mejorar su vida con sus hijos y luchar para darles sus estudios hasta graduarse.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia T. is 28 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Patricia works making pant suits, school uniforms, sweaters etc.

She delivers the suits and uniforms that she makes to schools and different institutions.  Patricia has been in this business for 6 years.  She is requesting this Kiva loan to invest in buying fabric to start making uniforms for the next school year.

Patricia's dream is to improve her life with her children and to work hard to provide them with an education until they graduate.

loans.use: To make pant suits and formal suits for schools

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benjamin; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ocres pinturas para las paredes de todo color el vende de forma ambulatoria y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y personas que le solicitan.       

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a member of the 'Unidos para el Triunfo' (United for Victory) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Benjamin is 40 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling ochre-based wall paints in all colors.  He sells these as a street trader and delivers them to his customers and people who request them.

Benjamin is requesting this loan to keep his business going.  He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep his business going

loans.name: Fany Carmita

texts.es:
Fany Carmita A. A. tiene 34 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Fany se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte conocer gente y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Fany Carmita A. A. is 34 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has three children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Fany is a farmer and she grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  She buys her products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Fany is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working and to provide her children with an education.

Fany likes to take part in sport, get to know people and celebrate the holidays.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Mentor

texts.es:
Mentor C. B. tiene 37 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Mentor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mentor C. B. is 37 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Mentor is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Mentor is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working and to provide his children with an education.

Mentor likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca Rosa Y. T. tiene 25 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y por medio del trabajo dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta pasear con la familia y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa Y. T. is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has two children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Blanca is a farmer and she grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  She buys her products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working and, through her work, to provide her children with an education.

Blanca likes going for walks with her family and watching television.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jesus T. V. tiene 22 años. Es soltero, vive con el papa, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Nelson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es crecer en el negocio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nelson Jesus T. V. is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his father in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province.  He has no children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Luz y Progreso" live 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in the canton of Chillanes.  The 17 members of this communal bank work as farmers and professionals.

Nelson is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans, peas and chayote squash.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells his crops in the Chillanes market and in the surrounding district.

He requests a loan to buy corn, bean, pea and chayote seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to buy the supplies he needs.  Farmers in this area face challenges such as pests, diseases and climatic changes.  His dream is to grow his business.

In his free time he enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es un una madre de familia trabajadora de carácter noble, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo Franco de 11 años. El trabajo al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta de zapatos y los fines de semana dende platillos criollos en la puerta de su casa. Ambos negocios le va muy bien. Pero el negocio que le da mayor importancia es la venta de zapatos, puesto que le es rentable, ya que son mucho los clientes quienes siempre le hacen pedido de esta mercadería. Es por ello que constantemente acude al mercado mayorista del centro de Lima, donde encuentra variedad de zapatos a precios módicos. En adelante desea adquirir un puesto de zapatos, en algún mercado, para así mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para evitar futuras complicaciones a su banco comunal, en donde es muy apreciada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de zapatos con la finalidad de tener un stock y de ese modo tener variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking mother and an upstanding woman, who lives in her own home along with her son Franco, who is 11 years old.  Rosa has a business selling shoes, and on the weekends she sells Creole food from the door of her house.  Both of these businesses are doing very well.  But the most important business for her is the shoe selling business; it is profitable, since she has many customers who always order her merchandise.  For this reason, she is constantly going to the wholesale market in the center of Lima, where she can find a variety of shoes at affordable prices.  In the future she wants to acquire a stall in a market where she can sell her shoes, to improve her quality of life.  This is her 16th loan with MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments on time so she can avoid future problems with her communal bank, where she is well respected.  With the loan she requests she will buy a greater quantity of shoes with the goal of increasing her inventory and, in this way, having a greater variety of shoes to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to have in stock for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 4 Group

texts.en:
Valeria is the coordinator of the group Banco mujeres poderosas 4 (Bank of Powerful Women). She makes her home in a simple structure here with her long-term partner. Valeria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this first loan, with which she plans to purchase curtains, blankets, and towels that she will sell. She will reinvest her profits in her business. She says that her most difficult challenge is that she doesn't have her own house. She plans to continue enjoying to dance and to sing.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to start a business, and her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy curtains, blankets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy antibiotics and vitamins

loans.name: Milagros De Mozoquilpan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Milagros de Mozoquilpan, porque todas las integrantes viven en esta comunidad. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11  integrantes.La señora Gregoria S. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 56 años,es casada,  no tiene estudios, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos ( 2 mujeres y 2 varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes   (tienda) que inicio hace 1 año con el esfuerzo de 9 años de ahorro de las ganancias de la venta de tortillas hechas a mano, con lo cual ha podido darle estudios a nivel profesional a dos de sus hijos.Ella comenta que gracias a que cuenta con el apoyo de créditos ha podido invertir en la compra de  mercancía de su tienda y con las ganacias ha podido ahorrar para la construcción de  su propio local  y quiere poder hacer un ahorro para su vejez porque ella piensa asi ser más independiente y no darle muchas molestias a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Milagros de Mozoquilpan' (Mozoquilpan Miracles) because all its members live in Mozoquilpan which is located in the State of Mexico. The group has 11 members.

Gregoria S. is the group's president.  She is 56 years old, married, and didn't attend school.  She is a saleswoman and has 4 children (2 daughters and 2 sons).  Gregoria has a grocery store which she set up one year ago with 9 years' worth of savings which she had managed to put aside from the profits she'd made selling hand-made tortillas.  This business also allowed her to provide two of her children with professional-level studies.  She comments that thanks to the fact that she has the support of loans, she has been able to invest in buying merchandise for her store and, with the profits, she has been able to save up to build her own premises.  She would now like to be able to save for her old age because she plans to be independent and not have to bother her children.

loans.use: To invest in her business and save for her old age

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es madre de una hija, madre soltera dedicada  a trabajar para el pan de cada día.  
Su trabajo es de docente de primaria en donde lleva años laborando. Lo que ha ido comprando materiales de construcción para hacer su casa de concreto ya que es de zinc. Con el apoyo de Afodenic es que ha logrado su comienzo. Con el crédito anterior su meta era comenzar la obra pero debido a que se enfermo y fue operada de vesícula no logro terminar. Y parte del dinero lo compro en medicamentos.
Lo que con este nuevo financiamiento comenzara su obra el poder comenzar a construir su casa. Que es su objetivo para un techo mejor. Ya tiene parte de materiales lo que comprara bloques, hierro, cemento, tablas entre otros y comenzar.
texts.en:
Angélica is a single mother with one daughter who works hard to make her daily bread.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has been in the job for years.  She has been buying building materials to rebuild her house from concrete since it is currently made from corrugated metal.  With the support of Afodenic she has managed to start this process.  Angélica's goal with her previous loan was to begin the job but she became ill, needed to have a gallbladder operation and consequently didn't manage to finish it.  Part of her loan money had to be used to buy medicine.

With this new loan, Angélica will start work on building her house.  Her goal is to have a better home.  She already has some of the materials and she will now buy blocks, iron, cement, floorboards, etc. and begin the job.

loans.use: To buy building materials so that she can start to build her house from concrete

loans.name: Angel Lindorfo

texts.es:
Angel Lindorfo Q. C. tiene 58 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y tener salud para trabajar.

Le gusta hacer viajes en el carro.
texts.en:
Angel Lindorfo Q. C. is 58 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Angel is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Angel is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to grow in his business and to remain in good health so that he can work.  He likes to go for rides in his car.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Adalicia  para final de año va a necesitar su segundo credikiva, pues quiere comprar telas y materias primas e insumos de confección  porque va a fabricar uniformes  de colegio. Con sus créditos su negocio ha cambiado, lo ha capitalizado logrando hacer mejoramiento de viviendas como su enchape en baldosas de cerámica y el cielo raso en la terraza que no tenia. Continúa con el sueño de tener un gran almacén y por eso se esfuerza para que cada día su desempeño en el trabajo se vea  reflejado  en bienestar. Hoy preparada para recibir su segundo credikiva   planea con él una   utilidad de 50%,  que proyecta ser una inversión exitosa, porque tiene ya encargados los uniformes del colegio. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Adalicia puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/179922
texts.en: Adalicia will need her second Kiva loan at the end of this year because she would like to buy fabric, materials and dressmaking supplies so that she can make school uniforms.  The loans she has had have changed her business.  She has capitalized on her loans, managing to improve her home with ceramic tiling and adding a ceiling to her terrace which she didn't have before.  She continues with her dream of having a large store and she works hard so that her daily commitment to her work is reflected in her well-being.  She is now ready to receive her second Kiva loan.  She plans to use it to make a profit of 50% which she believes will be a successful investment because she already has orders for the school uniforms.  If you would like to know Adalicia's story, you can follow this link: http://kiva.org/lend/179922

loans.use: To buy fabric, materials and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Margaritas De Endare Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO D. 12 INTEGRANTES SE LLAMA MARGARITAS D. ENDARE Y SE ELIGIO ESTE NOMBRE PORQUE LES AGRADAN MUCHO LAS FLORES Y PRINCIPALMENTE LA MARGARITA. ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD D. ENDARE,ESTADO D. MÉXICO. LA SRA. AMALIA ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO,TIENE 40 AÑOS, ESTUDIÓ LA SECUNDARIA Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CALZADO Y A LA COSTURA, TIENE 9 HIJOS, 6 MUJERES Y 3 HOMBRES.LA SRA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA D. MERCANCIA Y MATERIA PRIMA; HILOS, ESTAMBRE, GANCHOS ETC.ESPERA CON LA INVERSION QUE REALIZA A SU NEGOCIO OBTENER UTILIDADES QUE LE PERMITAN QUE SUS HIJOS CULMINEN SUS ESTUDIOS, ESPERA TAMBIEN QUE CADA UNO D. SUS HIJOS REALICE SU VIDA Y SEAN LA BASE D. SU FAMILIA PUES EL EJEMPLO QUE LES DA ES EL D. NUNCA DARSE POR VENCIDOS Y TRABAJAR DURO PARA PODER CONSEGUIR LO QUE SE PROPONGAN.
texts.en: This group of 12 members is called 'Margaritas D. Endare'. The group chose this name because they like flowers very much, principally the margarita. The group is located in the Endare Community, Mexico state. Amalia, the treasurer of the group, is 40, studied secondary school and now works selling shoes and dressmaking. Amalia has 9 children, 6 girls and 3 boys. She is seeking a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and primary materials - threads, yarn, hooks etc. She hopes with this investment in her business to obtain utilities that permit her children to finish their studies, and also hopes that each one of her children achieves success in life and becomes a stable family base. The example Amalia gives is that of never giving in to defeat and working hard to obtain what you plan to.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y responsable, es separada y vive en compañía de hijos, Cesar de 30 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Antonia siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, es entonces que se inició vendiendo ropa de manera informal recorriendo las calles del mercado. Luego de varios años, hoy vende frutas, en pequeño espacio que acondicionó dentro de su casa, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien, debido a la rentas que le genera. Es por ello que constantemente acude a los mercados mayoristas para abastecerse de frutas frescas, de esa manera logra captar más clientes. Han transcurrido un año ejerciendo este rubro, por lo que ha logrado ser muy conocida y querida por sus clientes y la gente de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, de esa manera se distrae. En adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio, para aumentar sus ganancias y vivir tranquilamente en su vejez. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones  a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar mayor cantidad de frutas a su negocio y así ofrecer variedad de mercadería.
texts.en: Antonia is 64 years old. She is a very kind and responsible mother who is separated and lives together with her son, Cesar, 30, together in their own home. Antonia has always worked in business, beginning by selling clothes in an informal way travelling the streets of the market. Now, after several years, she sells fruit in a small airconditioned space in her house. This business is doing very well, owing to the earnings that she generates. Antonia always goes to the wholesale markets to stock her shop with fresh fruit, and in this way captures more customers. She has been doing this for a year, and has managed to become very well known and loved by her customers and people in her neighbourhood. What Antonia likes most about her job is talking to her neighbours, as she is entertained by this. In the future Antonia wants to expand her business to increase her earnings and live peacefully in her old age. This is her 16th loan with MFP, and she knows that if she pays on time she can access other loans peacefully and without bringing complications to her communal bank, where she is a much loved member. With this loan she is seeking she will increase the amount of fruit in her business and offer a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: Acquire a larger quantity of fruit to sell

loans.name: Gregorio  De Jesus

texts.es: Gregorio P., de 38 años es un buen hombre que vive, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años en el Municipio de Soledad, a 10 minutos de Barranquilla; allí tiene su tienda llamada “El Niño Rey”,  la cual inició en el año 2005 y   gradualmente con su trabajo ha ido creciendo; él primero adquirió un punto frio  y   casi tres años después, con sus esfuerzos de ahorros la convirtió en tienda  y la  compró  porque  se encontraba en condiciones de arrendatario. Gregorio  es un hombre satisfecho por su trabajo en la tienda, porque hoy a consecuencia  de sus grandes sacrificios,  ha logrado  sostenerla  muy prospera. Su promedio de ventas está entre  $600.000 y $700.000 diarios, maneja un buen volumen de inventarios y su margen de contribución aproximado es de 15%, él planea integrar a su negocio un punto de ventas de bebidas frías, para comprarlas al por mayor y venderle a clientes potenciales, como pequeñas tiendas, estaderos,  establecimientos  y vendedores de refrescos,  que no tienen capacidad de comprar en grandes cantidades a la misma empresa y por consiguiente cuando se les termina su provisión,  deben esperar para hacer un pedido  y pierden clientela,  porque se demora la respuesta de sus distribuidores; con este proyecto Gregorio espera que puedan comprarle  en su tienda Niño Rey y responderle mas oportunamente a sus clientes y el resultado será que  Gregorio se gane el dinero por la intermediación y la oportunidad.   Con su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento  comprará arroz, aceite, granos,  refrescos  y bebidas en mayor volumen, antes de que aumenten sus precios al final del año y de esta manera también ganará un poco más y  ahorrará.
texts.en:
Gregorio P. is 38 years old and is a good-hearted man. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 15, in the town of  Soledad, 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There he runs a store called “El Niño Rey” [The Child King], which he started in 2005 and has expanded through hard work. He started with a vacant property and in three years, using his own work and savings, he made it into a store. He started out renting the property but eventually bought it.

Gregorio finds his work very satisfying, because after making sacrifices to start his store he has managed to keep it very prosperous. His daily sales come to between $600 and $700. He can put about 15% of that amount towards offsetting his fixed costs, and he keeps a good level of inventory. He would like to expand his business to include the sale of cold drinks, buying them wholesale and then selling them to potential clients such as small stores, restaurant owners, and soft drink stands. These clients typically cannot buy in large quantities and so when they run out of provisions they have to wait to put in an order, and the delays in distribution cause them to lose business. Gregorio hopes to be able to sell drinks to these clients directly from his store, thus providing them with faster service. This will be another opportunity for him to increase his earnings.

With this loan, which is his first through Kiva, he will buy rice, cooking oil, and grains, as well as soft drinks and other drinks in larger quantities. He wants to make this purchase before prices go up at the end of the year. He hopes this will allow him to earn a little more and put it into savings.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, cooking oil, and grains, as well as soft drinks and other drinks in large quantities.

loans.name: Ana Yesenia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 22 años de edad, vende hot dog y hamburguesas, vive con su familia tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, por el momento su hermana menor depende económicamente de ella al igual que su hijo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona de flujo de personas cerca de una zona recreativa, trabaja de 9:00am a 6:00 pm y lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San miguel.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de otro coche para colocar otro puesto de venta en otro sector, con este préstamo lograra instalarse en otro lugar a parte del que ya tiene así mejoraran sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Sueña con algún día instalar una casa donde pueda ofrecer los hot dog y las hamburguesas, mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 22 year old woman.  She sells hot dogs and hamburgers.  She lives with her family and has a one year old child.  Currently her son and her younger sister depend on her economically.

The business is located in an area with lots of foot traffic near a recreational zone.  She is open for business from 9am until 6pm and has been in business for three years.  She lives in San Miguel, San Miguel department.

She is asking for a loan to buy another hot dog cart to set up a second sales spot.  With this loan she will be able to set up in another place besides the one she now has so that her income to help her family will increase.

She dreams with one day having a house where she can sell the hot dogs and hamburgers and with improving her family’s condition.

loans.use: To buy a new hot dog cart.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gerardo es un hombre muy esforzado y trabajador pues le ha tocado trabajar  a pequeñas empresas realizando cuentas contables a su negocio. 
Ya que su oficio es de contabilidad y que ha venido realizando desde hace años para lograr pagar sus gastos.
Hoy en día vive solo, con un hijo a quien apoya con sus estudios. Su mayor meta es la realización de su vivienda que está bien deteriorada por ser la madera ya muy vieja,  y que ha venido comprando materiales de construcción, con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado, y que espera iniciar con este nuevo financiamiento ya que tiene piedras, arena, piedrín comprados y que comprara cemento, zinc, reglones, clavos, bloques para comenzar el arranque de dicha obra. En donde está contento porque será posible una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard working, dedicated man.  He has worked as an Accountant for small firms.  He is an Accountant and has worked as such for many years to cover expenses.

He currently lives alone with his son for whom he pays school costs.  His greatest goal is to fix up his house because it’s old and made of wood and is quite deteriorated.

He has been buying building materials and supplies with the loans that Afodenic has granted him. He hopes to start the project with this new loan.  He already has purchased stone, sand and gravel and now will buy cement, zinc metal sheeting, mason's levels, nails and concrete blocks to start the projects. He is happy because this will make a better dwelling possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Solidario Esfuerzo Con Vición Group

texts.es:
solidario Esfuerzos con visión.
La señora Edilma  Isabel L.  García,  tiene cuatro años de iniciar su negocio de venta de papas y pollo frito, al principio solo vendía las papas con el pasar del tiempo los clientes le pedían pollo frito, su carreta era pequeña y ahora ya tiene una carreta mas grande.  Su sueño es tener un pequeño local con mesas  donde pueda atender al cliente y darles un mejor servicio,  Al lado de sus dos hijos y su esposo seguirá luchando para salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para compra de productos comestibles para elaborar comida  También se une al grupo la señorita Claudia Jeaneth  M. quien con 30 años de edad desea seguir creciendo en su negocio para poder realizar sus sueños como vendedora, desea el crédito para comprar productos comestibles  aun tiene muchas metas para su vida y desea realizarlos.   El señor Anselmo L. G. quien viene de un lugar muy lejos para superarse cada día, solicita la oportunidad del crédito y así seguir luchando al lado de su familia, su venta de ropa variada está creciendo y en estas fechas navideñas desea aprovechar la demanda de los clientes para poder tener buenas ganancias y así tener un local muy grande donde pueda exhibir la ropa y no estar en la calle. Con el  crédito desea comprar mas variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
Esfuerzos con Visión (Efforts with Vision) Communal Bank

Mrs. Edilma  Isabel L.  García stated her fried potatoes and fried chicken business four years ago.  She used to just sell the potatoes.  As time went by customers would request fried chicken too.  Her cart was small but now she has a bigger one.  Her dream is to have a small locale with tables where she can take care of customers providing better service.  She will continue to struggle to get ahead alongside her husband and two children.  She is asking for the loan to by ingredients to prepare her food.

Miss Claudia Jeaneth  M., 30, joins the group hoping to continue to grow in her business in order to reach her dreams as a merchant.  She wants the loan to buy foodstuffs; she still has many unmet goals in life that she wants to accomplish.

Mr. Anselmo L. García who comes from very far away every day to get ahead is asking for the loan to continue struggling alongside his family.   His assorted clothing sales business is growing and he wants to take advantage of the Christmas season’s increased customer demand in order to have large profits to have a large locale where he can display and sell his clothes and not be in the street any longer.  He wants to use the loan to buy more assorted clothes.

loans.use: To buy edible products and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Hermilia

texts.es: Hermilia, de 64 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, es separada y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha inclinado a la costura, siempre le gustaba coser sus prendas y una vez que se casó, solo cosía las prendas de sus hijos. Desde entonces, decidió estudiar corte y confección, han transcurrido 18 años, y hoy no solo arregla las prendas; sino que confecciona vestidos y conjuntos para damas, con diseño propio. El taller que tiene se encuentra situado en el primer ambiente de su casa, es ahí donde recibe a todos sus clientes, ya sea para hacer algún remendado o para hacer las medidas de una prenda que confeccionará. En adelante, desea ampliar la construcción de su casa. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Además, es una socia muy responsable que lidera a su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas al por mayor de diversos grosores, para continuar trabajando en lo que más le gusta hacer.
texts.en:
Hermilia, 64, is hard working, responsible mother.  She’s separated and lives in her own house with her two children.  Since very young she was inclined to sewing; she always enjoyed making clothes and when she got married she made her children’s clothes.  Since then she decided to study clothing design and dressmaking.  Eighteen years have passed and today she not only repairs clothes but she makes dresses and suits for women that she designs herself.

Her workshop where she takes care of her customers, who come in both for clothing repairs and to have items custom made, is in the living room.   In the future she’d like to enlarge her house.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She knows that the contribution she’ll get will be very beneficial for her business’ development.  Besides, she’s a very responsible member who leads her communal bank.

She will use the requested funds to buy various fabrics at wholesale in a variety of weights to continue working at what she likes best to do.

loans.use: To buy fabric in a variety of colors and quality.

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda es una pequeña  comerciante que ha venido creciendo atreves de sus ventas, y apoyo de la institución pues lleva años trabajando en la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada.
Pues le ha tocado trabajar desde pequeña, hoy cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja  como ebanista. 
Con sus crédito ha mejorado su casa, con el crédito anterior puso cerámica hoy desea reparar la parte interna de la casa. En donde comprara los materiales necesarios para comenzar la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geoconda is a small businesswoman who has been growing through her sales and with support from the institution.  She has been selling new and used clothing for years because she has had to work ever since she was little.  Today, she has her husband’s support; he works as a cabinet maker.

She has used her loans to improve her house.  She used the previous loan to install tile and now she wants to repair the interior of the house.  She will buy the necessary materials and supplies to start to improve the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Originally from Colombia, Gustavo has been working for the last four years to create a successful lawn care and landscaping business. Like all small business owners, he struggled to keep his business afloat in the beginning but with hard work and dedication he was able to establish a business that supports two employees and has a strong reputation in the Miami community. Gustavo came to ACCION USA because it had become clear that he could not support his growing business with credit cards alone and needed the support of a lending institution to continue growing his business.

This is Gustavo’s first loan from ACCION USA. He is going to be purchasing newer and more equipment. In the landscaping business, providing customer service is key and Gustavo wants to be able to expand and provide the best services to his clientele. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make these purchases and work towards his future goal of taking on a more managerial position in the company. Ultimately, he wants to be able to stabilize and increase the standard of living for his family and the families of his employees.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 32 años, es una madre de familia con ganas de salir adelante, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha comprado su stand móvil, ubicado en la puerta de su casa, friendo salchichas, papas y pollos. Es así que lleva cerca de un año con esta labor, en lo que todos los días a partir de las 3:00PM, con mucha prisa sazona  los trozos de pollos y pela las papas listas para ferir, ya que a partir de las 6.00 de la tarde; solo se dedica freír y atender a sus clientes, quienes gustan de su sazón. Su negocio lo considera rentable, y con esas ganancias ayuda a cubrir parte de los gastos de su hogar. Es por ello que trabaja muy motivada, por lo que necesitará mas adelante comprarse una vitrina, con ella instalar una tienda dentro de su casa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente, de ese modo no generar complicaciones a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes amablemente la invitaron en este crédito. Con el crédito que solicitó, comprará accesorios de cocina, y productos de primera necesidad para no tener problemas al momento de preparar éstos platillos.
texts.en:
Rosario, 32, is a mother with a strong desire to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  With much effort she managed to buy her food cart which is located at her doorstep to fry sausages, potatoes and chicken. 

She has been in business for about a year.  Every day starting at 3pm, she quickly seasons the pieces of chicken and peels the potatoes to have them ready to fry because from 6pm on all she does is fry and tend to customers who enjoy her tasty preparations.

Her business is quite profitable and she uses the profits to help meet household expenses.  This is why she is so motivated to work.  Soon she will need to buy a display case in order to set up a store in her house.

This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion so as not to cause any difficulties for her fellow group members who so kindly invited her to join in this loan.

She will use the requested loan to buy cooking utensils and basic need items so that she won’t have any problems at the moment of preparing the meals.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and basic ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA R. L.
La señora María Raxón López, de 39 años  casada tiene 3 hijos 1 mayor de edad y dos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de Tortilla y veladoras , que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 10 y 5 años  de vender su tortilla de casa en casa, luego  su esposo la animo a que también vendiera veladoras  en su casa la cual ahora fabrican  desde  hace tres años, la venta de tortillería  inicio con el apoyo de su nuera  vendiendo de poco en poco mientras su nuera los hacia ella salía a la calle para ofrecer, con el tiempo puedo tener a una persona que le ayudara a sacar su venta ya que con el tiempo las personas la conocían y le pedían por cantidades grandes para festividades sociales, en su tiempo libre también se dedica a la venta de atoles, venta de fruta , frijol, también sale a lavar de casa en casa, su  mayor deseo es poder invertir un poco más  en la fabricación de veladoras, el deseo que tiene para sus hijos es que salgan adelante  ella y su esposo .
texts.en:
María Raxón López, 39, is married and has three children, one older and two younger. Her business is the sale of tortillas and candles from her home. She sold her tortillas door-to-door for 15 years. Then her husband encouraged her to also sell candles from their home. They have been making and selling candles for three years. 

The tortilla business began with support from María’s daughter-in-law, who would make the tortillas while María would go out and do sales. Later, she was able to employ another person to help out. Now, she is well known and often receives large orders for social events.

In her spare time, María sells atole (hot corn drink), fruit, and beans. She also does washing from door-to-door. Her greatest desire is to be able to invest more in the candle business, and that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: Fabrication of candles

loans.name: Manuel Tomas

texts.es:
Manuel elabora zapatillas y las distribuye a diferentes tiendas. Vive con su esposa y dos hijo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.
 
Hace años atrás el vivía en la ciudad Esmeraldas del Ecuador donde es muy turístico hacer zapatillas porque es donde quedan la mayorías de las playas. Pero  cuando se mudo a Guayaquil para tener más oportunidades de negocio.  Por esa buena dedición y por recorrer las calles de Guayaquil recorriendo para vender las zapatillas el pudo encontrar tienda para venderle la mercadería al por mayor.  En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su hijo confeccionando zapatillas para venderlas a un volumen alto (en la foto aparecen las cajas donde va a repartir las zapatillas). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales, cuero, plantillas, fibra para elaborar zapatillas. En el futuro quiere tener un canal de distribución grande de calzado y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel manufactures sandals that he sells to various stores.  He lives with his wife and two children in an urban area, called Guasmo, notable because most of its residents are merchants.

Years ago he used to live in the city of Esmeraldas del Ecuador which is a beach resort.   Sandal making is very popular there because that’s where most of the beaches are.  He moved to Guayaquil, however, to have more business opportunities.  That was a good decision and while wandering through Guayaquil’s streets he found several stores to sell his sandals to at wholesale.  He currently works with one of his son’s help making sandals to sell at high volume.  (The photo shows the boxes used to distribute the sandals.)

He will use the loan to buy materials and supplies: leather, soles and fiber to make the sandals.  In the future he’d like to have a major distribution channel and to build his house better.

loans.use: For shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es:
Gladys Narváez es una persona muy activa y dinámica, que le gusta mucho el negocio, característica de sus ancestros por eso ella lo aprendió casi que de una manera  instintiva. Ella se dedica a  la actividad de comerciante y en sus inicios lo hizo mediante la venta de mercancía por encargo de   sus compañeras de trabajo y del personal de empleados del algunas empresas; también realizaba labores de costuras, siendo su especialidad  elaborar ropa infantil femenina, esa época fue muy difícil para ella  porque sus 2 hijos estaban pequeños y los ingresos eran muy pocos. Pero un día unas amigas  le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  se interesó  y con 3 amigas   conformaron  el grupo  solidario Las Kenesianas y recibieron su primer  crédito de $60.000.oo COP para pagarlos en 4 cuotas. Con este dinero compró mercancía y le dio más impulso a su   negocio, por lo cual considera que “pagar con puntualidad las cuotas pactadas y no quedar mal es primordial para seguir adelante apoyada por esta organización, o por quienes le den la mano”. Su negocio ha sido un peldaño importante para su  vida y la de su familia, porque todos han puesto su granito de arena para sacarlo adelante. En el  negocio Gladys vende papelería, detalles, ropa de niños y niñas, pequeños electrodomésticos, refrescos, cervezas y con sus ganancias ha logrado ayudar a formar profesionalmente a su hija hasta terminar su carrera de Contaduría Pública como también a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.    Gladys   se siente  muy contenta ella goza  dándole gracias a Dios y a la Fundación por los beneficio recibidos y la confianza de esta al otorgarle prestamos consecutivos a los largo de 18 años, por su  buen manejo de responsabilidad y sentido de pertenencia.  Gladys considera que a lo largo  de todos estos años, la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha sido muy enriquecedora con sus capacitaciones y su apoyo económico para el crecimiento y el buen manejo del negocio, tanto en la parte espiritual como material, porque esto le ha servido para encontrarse en paz con Dios y expresar agradecimientos a  la fundación, y a  las personas que de una u otra forma le han colaborado para que los resultados sean positivos. Con los cursos de formación microempresarial en los que ha participado, aprendió a distinguir entre clientes buenos y malos, así como mercancías que son más fácil de vender y otras no, a ser ordenada con los recaudos y a tener una visión  diferente con respecto a los proveedores, ya que no es muy partidaria de adquirir mercancías a crédito, sino comprarlas con el efectivo por lo que manifiesta que le deja un mayor margen de utilidad.
En la actualidad ha logrado conformar en sociedad una Cooperativa Multiactiva que se encuentra legalizada en la cámara de comercio, producto de los conocimientos adquiridos en el largo recorrido de su carrera como microempresaria, y de los  ofrecidos por la fundación que han sido muy importante y de  apoyo para alcanzar  sus metas y consolidar este , su proyecto de vida.  
Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y carismática que se desempeña como docente en un Hogar Infantil,  ubicado en sur occidente de la ciudad donde se atienden Niños de escasos recursos. De su grupo inicial “ Las Kenesianas” la única que ha permanecido consecutivamente es   Gladys, porque es persistente y disciplinada, ella es una mujer felizmente realizada y a punto de recibir su  pensión.
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva que es el financiamiento número 22 y con el piensa comprar mercancías para surtir su negocio en la época mas linda porque concentra a la familia en su hogar con festividades mientras lucen vestidos, calzados, accesorios y perfumes que Gladys vende a crédito y de contado.
Su desafío y meta principal es dedicarse completamente a la cooperativa multiactiva, así  como también a su familia y a sus nietos, futuros herederos del negocio que con mucha disciplina, esfuerzo y trabajo ha levantado.
texts.en:
Gladys Narvaéz is a very active and dynamic person who likes business a lot.  This is a characteristic of her ancestors and she learned it almost instinctively.  Gladys is a saleswoman.  Initially she sold merchandise which her work colleagues and employees of other businesses ordered.  She also performed sewing tasks, her speciality being making clothes for little girls.  This period was very difficult for her because her two children were young and her income was very small.  However, one day some friends talked to her about Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she became interested.  Together with three friends, she set up the 'Las Kenesianas' solidarity group and they received their first loan for 60,000 Colombian pesos which was to be repaid over 4 instalments.  With this money, she bought merchandise and it gave her business a boost.  She considers that “paying your instalments punctually and not making a bad impression is essential if you want to continue to get ahead with the support of this organization or those who are giving you a hand”.  

Gladys' business has been an important stepping stone in her life and that of her family because everybody has done their bit to get her business ahead.  In her business, Gladys sells stationery, notions, boys' and girls' clothing, small domestic appliances, soft drinks, beer and, with her profits, she has managed to help train her daughter professionally until she finished her course in Public Accountancy.  It has also helped her to improve the condition of her home.  Gladys feels very happy.  She gives thanks to God and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the benefits which she has received and the trust that the organization has placed in her by giving her consecutive loans for 18 years, for their good management, responsibility and sense of belonging.  Gladys considers that throughout all these years, being a part of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been a very enriching experience with their training programs and their financial support.  They have helped her business to grow and helped her to manage it well, both spiritually and materially.  This has helped her to find herself at peace with God and she is grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and the people who in one way or another have contributed to her positive results.  Through the small business courses which she has participated in, she has learned to distinguish between good customers and bad customers as well as between goods which are easy to sell and others which are not.  She is now organized in her accounts and has a different view with respect to her providers since she is no longer a fan of acquiring goods on credit, rather she prefers to buy in cash because she says that this gives her a bigger profit margin.

She has currently managed to form a Multiactive Cooperative which has been legalized in the Chamber of Commerce.  This is a product of the knowledge which she has acquired throughout her long career as a small businesswoman.  The training she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been very important and has supported her so that she can achieve her goals and consolidate her life's project.

Gladys is a hard-working and charismatic woman who works as a teacher in a child development center located in the south-west of the city where she looks after children whose parents have low economic means.  From her initial 'Las Kenesianas' group, the only one who has remained consecutively is Gladys because she is persistent and disciplined.  She is a woman who feels happily fulfilled and is about to receive her pension.  She is currently applying for her Kiva loan, which is her 22nd loan, and plans to use it to buy merchandise to stock her business in this period of the year which is the most beautiful because she gets her family together in her home and gets to enjoy the festive season while everyone shows off dresses, shoes, accessories and perfumes which Gladys sells on credit and for cash.

Glady's challenge and main goal is to dedicate herself entirely to the multiactive cooperative as well as to her family and her grandchildren who are the future heirs to her business which she has built up with a lot of discipline, effort and hard work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business in this most beautiful of seasons when her family gets together in her home to celebrate the festive season whilst they show off dresses , shoes, accessories and perfumes which Gladys sells on credit or for cash

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer comerciante que que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución tiene cinco años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara más productos en ropa variada para dama, caballeros, niños, zapatos, cosméticos y así lograr satisfacer al cliente con nueva variedad.
Como planes es seguir creciendo, vender productos nuevos, a si como la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is a saleswoman who has grown in her business thanks to her tenacity and the support of our institution.  She has been in her business for five years.  She started with small purchases of merchandise and these days, with the help of AFODENIC, her sales levels have increased and she can offer more variety in her merchandise with more competitive prices.

She will use this new loan to buy more products; men's, women's and children's clothes, shoes and cosmetics.  She will thereby manage to satisfy her customers with a new selection of products.

Her plan is to continue growing, selling new products and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To invest in buying women's, men's and children's clothes, cosmetics and shoes, thereby increasing her sales

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 32 años, es una joven soltera y muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y a sus dos hermanas menores. Hace muchos años trabaja como asistenta contable en una empresa y hace 2 años pensó en instalar un negocio de ropa. Desde entonces se dedica en la venta de ropa para bebes, en un local alquilado, dentro de un mercado; el más concurrido de su distrito, que se encuentra a media hora de su casa. De esta manera su padre y hermana menor la apoyan en este negocio, sin embargo los fines de semana, esta ella encargada del negocio, ya que hay mucha afluencia de gente. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que le permite captar buenas utilidades. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio con diversidad de prendas, para que pueda cumplir con la demanda del cliente. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más prendas de bebes, asimismo piensa comprar ropa casual para damas y varones, para así diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old.  She is a single and very enterprising young woman.  She lives in her parents' house with her parents and her two younger siblings.  She has been working as an assistant accountant in a firm for many years and two years ago she set up her own clothes business.

Since that time, Erika has worked selling baby clothes from her rented premises, in the busiest market in her district, which is half an hour away from her home.  Her father and older sister support her in this business.  However, on weekends she is in charge of the business since there are a lot of people.  What she most likes about her business is that it allows her to make good profits.  In the future, she would like to expand her business with a variety of garments so that she can satisfy her customers' demand.

This is Erika's first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She will use her loan to increase the amount of baby garments she sells.  She also plans to buy casual clothing for women and men so that she can diversify her business.

loans.use: To acquire baby clothes and casual clothes for men and women

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto con sus  2 hermanos menores. Por ser la mayor de los hermanos, se siente en la responsabilidad de atender a sus hermanos, que por el momento se encuentran desempleados. Es por ello, que por las mañanas trabaja como profesora en un colegio y por la tarde se desempeña de cajera en un mega mercado, a una hora de su casa. Gracias a este trabajo, pudo comprarse un motocarro, vehículo que su hermano lo utiliza para ofrecer el servicio de transporte público, desde entonces le va muy bien. Ahora los dos pactaron en ayudar al último de los hermanos, y le han propuesto un trabajo, vendiendo ropa. En adelante piensa sacar su titulo de profesora. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para emprender nuevos horizontes en el negocio, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará prenda de vestir casual, para que su hermano se dedique en la venta.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 25, is a hard working young woman.  She lives with her parents and two younger brothers.  Because she’s the oldest she feels responsible for taking care of them; they are currently unemployed.

Because of this she works as a Teacher in a school during the mornings and in the afternoons she’s employed as a Cashier at a supermarket an hour away from home.

Thanks to the work she was able to buy herself a moto car, a vehicle that her brother uses to provide public transportation services.  Since then he does quite well.

Now the two of them have made a pact to help the remaining brother and they proposed a job for him: selling clothes.

She hopes to get a Teaching degree in the future. 

This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she knows that the contribution will be very beneficial to open up new business horizons so she pledges to repay on time.

She will use the requested loan to buy casual clothes that her brother can work at selling.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Norma se dedica al comercio desde hace cinco años, los productos que vende es ropa de dama, cosméticos, prendas de plata. Iniciando este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar  a sus dos hijos. Trabajando en una empresa privada de zona franca y su pequeño negocio.
En donde opta por incrementar las ventas y renuncia a su trabajo. Lo que necesitaba era más capital para comercializar sus productos, siendo Afodenic una puerta para el progreso de su familia.
Su esposo también ha sido fundamental en su vida, ya que siempre la ha motivado y apoyo económicamente con sus ventas. El cual trabaja como conductor de bus.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara: ropa nueva de dama, caballero, producto de la zermat el cual vende por catálogos ya que ha logrado captar clientela, lo que le ha permitido el aumento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma has been a merchant for the last five years.  She sells women’s clothes, cosmetics and silver articles.  She started the business aiming at supporting her two children.  She was employed at a small firm in the Free Zone and worked her small business.  She opted to increase sales and quit her job.  What she needed most was capital to sell her products.  Afodenic was a doorway toward her family’s progress.

Her husband has also been fundamental in her life because he has always motivated and supported her economically with the sales.  He’s employed as a bus driver.

She will use this new loan to buy new women’s and men’s clothes and Zermat brand products, which are sold via catalogue and for which she has steady customers, thus leading to business growth.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics to improve sales.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en diversos oficios y en la actualidad trabaja como ama  de llaves, asimismo vende productos de belleza. En su trabajo, aprovecha en ofrecer sus cosméticos a los dueños de la casa y al resto de sus  vecinas. Cuando sus familiares tienen  compromisos de cumpleaños, optan en comprarla  a ella, por la gran variedad de productos que tiene en stock. Es así que su negocio le resulta muy rentable, solo que a veces tiene inconvenientes; cuando no le pagan a tiempo. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es la facilidad que tiene para captar clientes, lo cual le tiene como plan ampliar su negocio y poner su stand de cosméticos en su casa para recibir más gente. Este es su 18avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en todo este tiempo. Es muy querida y respetada en su grupo comunal, ya que es la secretaria de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, incrementará más productos de belleza, para tener su stock, asimismo abastecer los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, is a hard working, responsible woman living in her own house with her husband and four children.  She has worked at a variety of jobs since she was very young.  She is currently a housekeeper and also sells beauty products.  She takes advantage of her job to offer cosmetics to the home owners and to the rest of her neighbors.  When her relatives have birthday presents to buy they get them from her because of the large variety of products she stocks.  The business, then, is quite profitable.

Sometimes she does have the inconvenience caused by customers that don’t pay on time.  What she likes best about the business, though, is the ease with which she acquires customers so her plan is to expand the business and set up her cosmetics stand in her house so that she can receive more customers.

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she commits to repay on time as she has done so to date.

She is highly respected and liked by her fellow members since she’s the communal bank Secretary.

She will use the loan to increase the amount of beauty products both to have in stock and to fill pending orders.

loans.use: To increase the amount of cosmetics she has to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Renan Alonso

texts.es:
Renan de 40 años,  es taxista informal. Vive con su esposa y dos hijo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Por la falta de oportunidades compro un carro para convertirlo en taxi informal y poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am recorriendo las calles de todo Guayaquil y cobrando por viaje desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 10.00. Unos de los inconvenientes es trabajar en las noches debido al índice muy elevado de la delincuencia. 

Para seguir trabajando en su carro él quiere comprar unos repuesto para su carro. En el futuro quiere comprar otro taxi para tener más ingresos y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Renan is 40 years old and works as a gypsy cab driver.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 2 and 4,  in an urban area called Guasmo, which is mostly inhabited by merchants.  

For a lack of opportunities, he bought a car to convert into a gypsy cab and support his wife and two children.  He currently works until 7:00am, driving through all of the streets of Guayaquil.  He charges between $1 and $10 per trip.  One of the inconvenient things about working at night is the high level of crime.

With this loan, he would like to purchase parts for his car.  In the future he would like to buy another taxi to earn more income and give his children a better life.

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es: Ruth María N.  vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Soledad,  donde vende productos naturales y mercancía variada;  es muy usual encontrar en su negocio  vitaminas, Omega 3 entre otros productos  como fantasías, cosméticos, aunque también vende calzado y ropa interior y para niños. Ella inició este negocio puerta a puerta  en el año 2004 entusiasmada por su cónyuge,  que se dedica a la litografía y  haciendo trabajos a los laboratorios conoció los que hoy son los  proveedores de Ruth María y a los que  inició comprándole  $200.000 COP,   en productos naturales como los ya mencionados;    gradualmente  Ruth ha ido adicionando otros artículos, como ropa, fantasías, cosméticos y casi todo lo que sus clientes necesitan para su vida diaria, porque ha  aprovechado efectivamente  la gran clientela que se desprendió de su negocio inicial de venta de productos naturales. Sus principales clientes, son los habitantes del barrio y muchos referidos de estos en  otras comunidades; Ruth María es una muy buena empresaria que les acredita  a sus clientes  solo lo que ellos pueden pagar  y en los plazos acordados, por eso recupera su cartera semanalmente y algunos en cada quincena. Ella compra de contado y adquiere frecuentemente descuentos, porque sus proveedores la conocen muy bien y a su vez sabe como negociar sus compras. Su margen de contribución es del 40%   con respecto a los productos naturales,  recupera esta  inversión con la primera cuota, pero regularmente las  divide en 4   plazos de pago de acuerdo a cada cliente y también hace algunas excepciones con un pequeño número de sus compradores ofreciéndoles plazos especiales un poco más largos,  pero no muy usuales.  Relacionado con la mercancía que distribuye su margen de contribución  es de 45% y los planea con sus clientes en 2 cuotas. Su sueño ahora es tener un punto de ventas en un sitio estratégico, pero sabe que se requiere un capital inicial importante y por eso está trabajando fuertemente para lograrlo. Con su Credikiva que es su primer financiamiento comprará productos naturales que tiene encargados por sus clientes y también jeans, calzado, ropa interior y especialmente vestidos para niños, teniendo en cuenta que en las fiestas los padres de familia vestirán a sus pequeños con nueva ropa y estos a su vez lucirán los vestidos de Ruth María con mucha alegría y distinción.
texts.en:
Ruth María N. lives in Soledad’s Los Almendros neighborhood where she sells natural products and assorted merchandise.  It is quite usual to find vitamins and Omega 3 among other products like costume jewelry, and cosmetics in her store.  She also sells footwear, underwear and children’s clothes.

She started the business around 2004 encouraged by her spouse to do so.  He is a lithographer and while doing jobs for laboratories he got to know the people who today are Ruth Maria’s suppliers and from whom he originally bought $200,000COP worth of natural products like the ones already mentioned.

Gradually Ruth has been adding other items like: clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and almost everything else customers need in their daily lives because she’s known how to take advantage of the vast clientele that her initial natural products business generated. Her main customers are residents of the neighborhood and referrals from them who live in other areas.

Ruth María is quite a good businesswoman who floats her customers just the amount of credit they are able to repay in the time agreed upon.  Thus she recovers her outstanding debts weekly and some biweekly. She, however, pays cash so often gets discounts because her suppliers know her well and she is very good at negotiating her purchases.

Her recovery margin on the natural products is 40% and she usually gets that back on the first installment.  However, she splits up the amount into four installments according to the customer and sometimes makes exceptions for some customers giving them still longer repayment schedules; but this isn’t too common.  The other merchandise has a 45% margin and that she recovers in two installments.

Her dream now is to have a point of sale in some strategic location but she knows she needs an important injection of capital to do so.  This is why she’s working so hard to accomplish this.

With the Kiva loan, which is her first loan, she will buy natural products that she has pending orders for as well as jeans, footwear, underwear and especially children’s clothes keeping in mind that during the festive season that’s approaching parents will dress up their children in new outfits and the children will sport Ruth Maria’s outfits with much cheer and distinction.

loans.use: She will buy natural products her customers have ordered and also will buy jeans, shoes, underwear and especially children’s clothes.

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es: Yecenia tiene 31 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años vende chanchos, para comprar y cría en su casa, prefiere comprar hembras para que pueda aparearlas, para luego vender las crías en las ferias comerciales de su zona. Le agrada vender cerdos, lo considera un negocio rentable, porque  su ciclo de reproducción es rápido, además que se reproducen en cantidad. Paralelo a esta actividad trabaja de manera dependiente, por lo que así puede tener más ingresos. Su deseo es mejorar su establo y aumentar la cantidad de cerdos que tiene. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos e incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Yecenia is 31 years old and lives with her four children in her own home.  

For more than seven years, she has sold pigs.  She buys them and raises them in her home.  She prefers to buy females because they can be bred, and then the offspring can be sold at markets in her area.  She considers this a profitable business because the pig's reproductive cycle is fast and they reproduce in a large quantity.  In addition, she also works as a salesclerk so she can earn more income.  

She would like to improve her stable and increase the number of pigs she owns.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is happy to be part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is thankful to all of the people who will make this loan possible because it will be very useful to the progress of her business.  

With this loan, she will purchase more pigs and increase her capital.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
