Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shaushan

texts.en: Shaushan D. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. Her three children all attend a local school. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Shaushan operates a business selling coal in her town. Her husband helps her in the business. He purchases coal directly from local mines and uses his large Russian truck to transport it back to his town. She sells the coal to various local businesses and individuals to use for heating. Shaushan has operated this business since 2000 and has gained much experience over the years. During the winter months, her business sees very high demand because coal is an important energy and heating source in Mongolia. For the future, they plan to continue to operate their business and increase their business earnings. They have used their business earnings to improve their family's standard of living. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase new tires for her husband's truck.

loans.use: To purchase new tires

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 38 year-old woman married to Tanga, a tailor, who is 40 years old. Together, they are blessed with two children, ages 15 and 10.

Veronica has been in the retail business for 12 years. Over this period she has been able to identify many potential customers. Veronica was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to purchase stock for her shop, such as sugar, flour, rice, soda, and bread. Veronica will use the anticipated profits to educate her children to the highest level possible. Her hope is to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail business

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is married with two children. She sells caps and other sportswear in the central city market. Munavar has been in this trade for 5 years. She is very communicative and has many acquaintances in the market. Her enterprising and adventurous spirit has helped her start this venture and stimulate its growth. Munavar is an active hard-worker who works long hours. All her customers give her positive references. We believe her constant desire to see her business expand and grow is her best motivation for prompt loan repayment. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
S. Gulmira is 34 years old and widow and with three children. She sells jewelry. As a rule she works in the store, but she also has a trading place in the local market. Gulmira sells jewelry items in the oriental national style. People trust her knowing that she is very in honest in her pricing and quality. Gulmira's business is the main source of income for her family. She has been working with IMON for three years and proved herself an honest, reliable borrower. Today she requests 7500 Somoni to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings and bracelets in the oriental style. She thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new items of jewelry in the national style.

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en: Tseren S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a fireman and her two children both attend a local high school. She has been operating a meat-product trading business in a rented space at the local market since February, 2010. She has had success with her new business and built a stable operation within a short period. Today, her daily sales income is between 5,000 and 15,000 MNT and her working capital exceeds 170,000 MNT. She has used her earnings to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and increase her working capital. Tseren is a very honest, helpful, and hardworking woman and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more sub-products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, charcoal, pepper, and salt to make food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cutlasses, hinges, nails, hammers, knives, and shovels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase laboratory apparatus

loans.name: Chebon

texts.en:
N. Chebon is a 49-year-old widow.  N. supports a family of seven, mainly her children, whose ages range between 28 years to 8 years old. N. runs a grocery store and a retail shop in Kapkiamo trading centre, which is where she gets most of her customers.

She has been in this business for the last nine years and she gets an average income of 10,000 KES a month from her business. She has previously borrowed 40,000 KES.  This will be her fourth loan with Kadet Ltd and has successfuly paid the previous loans.

N. intends to use the loan to increase her business stock. She will use 30,000 KES to purchase stock for her retail shop and 10,000 KES for her grocery.

She anticipates using the profits from the business to educate her children and use the rest to expand her retail shop and start horticulture farming.

loans.use: To add more stock to her retail shop and grocery

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
S. Muzafar has been baking traditional bread since a young age. He inherited this skill from his father and grandfather. His working day starts at 4 a.m. when he and his assistants begin to knead dough, form the bread, and heat the stove. At the beginning, Muzafar kneads dough from two sacks of flour of 50 kg. each. The winter is an important period for his business, as there are many holidays this season. He needs to have a stock of flours and coal. For this reason Muzafar applied to IMON International for a loan of 8,200 Somoni. Muzafar and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg T. is 64 years old and lives with husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Narantsetseg and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town. They sell a variety of meats to her customers at a stall in the local market. She started her business in 2000 and has since gained a lot of experience as a trader. They plan to purchase and preserve a large amount of meat when prices for such products are cheap due to the spread of animal disease. 

Narantsetseg obtained a previous loan from the Xacbank in order to build a house and fence and still pays it. This loan will be her second loan, and she has proven herself to be a trustworthy customer. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman and says, "I am planning to buy a large amount of meats at a cheap price and sell them as a retailer which might be very profitable." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of children's clothes

loans.name: Safina Ramadhani

texts.en:
Safina Ramadhan W. is a 36 year old woman who is married to Abdi Wekesa. They have three children. Her husband works in transportation to increase the family’s income. They live in Kahoya in Eldoret Town where Safina runs a cafeteria. She has run her business for three years and earns a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.

This will be Safina’s first loan from KADET and she plans to buy inventory for her business and buy more seats for her café. With the income from the loan, Safina want to expand her business to accommodate more customers.

In future, Safina plans to educate her children and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa P. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her husband, Altangerel, works as a loader in the transportation service company and her two children attend a local secondary school. 

Tsevelmaa owns and operates a traditional Mongolian clothing business in her town. She partners with several other seamstresses and designs, produces, and tailors a wide variety of traditional Mongolian clothing items. Tsevelmaa has been sewing clothing and gaining tailoring experience since she was 18. In 2006, she began collaborating with other seamstresses and over the years she has built a positive reputation among her customers. 

Tsevelmaa’s main family sources of income are from her business earnings and from livestock owned by her family. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase fabrics and materials as well as a sewing machine. In the future, Tsevelmaa hopes to further expand her business and establish her own tailoring factory.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Silah Kiprono

texts.en:
Silah Kiprono K. is a 38-year-old businessman who buys cows and sells them to customers at a profit. He is married to Lydia Chebii and they have four children ages three, eight, 12 and 18. Silah has been running his business in Chepkosum Eldoret, Kenya for the past two years. 

Silah was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and he has no other history with other microfinance institutions. He is applying for a first loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more cows to sell and improve his customer service. 

In the future, Silah hopes to expand his business to other towns around Eldoret.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod lives and works in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He owns a business selling clothing and footwear at the local market. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise that is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Farhod stay afloat with his business for six years. In fact, he has not only managed to keep his business sustainable and profitable, but has also increased his working capital. Farhod decided to go into this line of business because competition is lacking. He feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Farhod is a focused entrepreneur looking for growth and further expansion of his venture. He believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of his business. Farhod is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to increase his working capital. 
                                                                                    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Marko Ekama

texts.en:
Marko Ekama L. is a man of 22 years, married and a father of two beautiful children. His wife Elizabeth Nakiridi Allan has a charcoal business, which adds to the family income together with Marko's motorcycle transport business. They live in Eldoret Town where they operate their separate businesses. Marko gets a monthly income of 9,000 shillings and has been in this business for nine years now.

With this loan, Marko plans to boost the wife's business by buying more charcoal for resale. This will be his first loan from KADET and with the income he is going to get, he plans to buy more charcoal and use the rest of the money to feed his family. In the future, he plans to buy land and build rental houses to increase his family income and to educate his children and send them to the best schools in Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Theresa Adhiambo

texts.en:
Theresa D. is a 30-year-old industrious lady in Kisumu City, a lakeside town in Western Kenya. Theresa, who is a single lady, is a mother to Alvan David who is three years old. She lives with her two siblings, a brother and a sister. 

Theresa knows the meaning of diversification since she operates a salon and boutique in the heart of Kisumu City and has been doing this for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  A need for micro-credit arose and she joined Kadet Ltd and is now taking her first loan which she will use to buy a hair dryer, blower, and also add more shoes to her boutique. She plans to maintain a good credit history so that she might be considered for subsequent loans.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay schools fees for her son and also some to support her siblings. Her dream and hope is to expand her salon to be big and also open a boutique shop for selling shoes and clothing.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer for the salon and also add shoe stock for the boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nut and fish

loans.name: Naisenke Salaash

texts.en:
For the last four years, Naisenke has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town.  She is 23 years-old and married to Nkirimpa Ole Sitei. They have one child.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy ten goats and fifteen sheep which she will raise and later sell for a profit.

In the future, she hopes to open a retail shop which will suppliment her livestock income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Mary Wangui

texts.en:
For the last two years, Mary farmed in Ndunyu Njeru town.  She is 49 years-old, married to John Kimani and they have two children.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET Ltd. by a friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labour during planting.

In the future, Mary hopes to utilise a bigger percentage of her farm for farming as most of it currently lies idle.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a hardworking lady with four children.  To earn a living, she runs a grocery shop.  Her business is located along the road hence so she gets a good number of customers.  In order to boost her income, she also sells second-hand clothes.  She joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access loans easily. She has requested a loan of 40, 000 Kes to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Okumu Taka

texts.en:
Okumu R. Taka is a modest Kenyan enterpreneur from the county of Vihiga , Western Kenya. She is married to Samuel Lwegado, a 38 year-old insurance agent. They have three children aged 10, seven and one years old and they live in the Manugi suburb of Vihiga.

It is now nine years since R. established a retail shop business. She has experienced some good success since she is able to make a monthly income of Kshs. 14,500. R. is a long time client of Kiva partner Kadet Limited and she is taking her eighth loan.  She will use it to buy household items to sell in her retail shop. She will use some of the profits to repay the loan and the rest to pay school fees for her children.

Her wish is to establish a big supermarket where she will be able to stock a variety of items for her customers.

loans.use: To buy household goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bread, meat, spaghetti, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 36-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with five children. To raise her family, she operates a cafeteria. She has been running the business for three years. She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy furniture, soda and cakes.

loans.use: To buy furniture, cakes and soda

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 56-year-old single lady and a mother of a 24-year-old girl. She has been operating a retail shop for 12 years, which has enabled her to identify potential clients and also master the commodities that sell fast.

This is her first loan from Kadet after she was introduced to Kadet by a friend. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to the retail shop, e.g. sugar worth 5,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.), rice worth Kshs. 5,000, and flour worth Kshs.5,000. 

Cecilia plans to use the expected profits to open a business for her daughter. She hopes  to grow the business in the future to own a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  Hadjah lives in a rented home where she has access to electricity but has no piped water. For the past 10 years, Hadjah has run a business at the local market retailing second-hand clothes. She works seven days a week and her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and rent. 

Hadjah is requesting a loan of 600,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her main business challenges include transportation difficulties and the rainy season.  Hadjah’s business goals and aspirations are to start importing second hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainab M. is a 21 year old married lady who has one child. She operates a retail shop in Maweni area, Malindi. She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be her second loan. Zainab is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to expand her business by buying stock and repairing her business premises. Zainab hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow, and she will be able to use her profits to help support her family. In the future, Zainab hopes to own a flourishing supermarket.

loans.use: to buy stock and undertake repairs

loans.name: Jinja Tweyambe Group-Jinja

texts.en:
David W. is 45 years old and is the happily married father of ten. For the last 31 years, he has been selling cattle and goats in Ivunamba-Jinja. He inherited his business from his late father. He also is a farmer. David estimates that he makes as much as 80,000 UGX each week, depending on the number of cows he sells. 

David belongs to the Jinja Tweyambe Group and will use his portion of this loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter J. is a 23-year-old single man. This gentleman sells charcoal to residents of Marereni where he resides in Malindi town.  Peter has been operating his business for three years now. 

He wishes to expand his business with the loan he has taken. This is the second time that Peter has taken a loan from KADET Ltd.  The loan amounts to 40,000 KES and he intends to add more charcoal for sale, as well as repair his business premises so as to propagate the growth of his business. By growing the business, Peter will be able to satisfy his customers who are mostly from the area where his business is situated. 

He hopes to eventually come to own a wholesale charcoal business where he would be able to sell his charcoal products in bulk to hotels around Marereni and other towns.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale and repair the business premises

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, who is 49 years old, does welding for a living.  He has been in the business for four years and hopes that someday he will open a hardware shop.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and employed two people.  He has also managed to send his children to school.

He has requested 60,000 KES to buy tubes, a buffing machine and a spraying machine.

loans.use: To buy tubes, buffing machine and spraying machine.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis es socia del Bancomunal Cusi Urpi, tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta D. cereales. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. cereales al por mayor. Gertrudis aprendió esto D. la venta D. cereales por su suegra, los cereales que acopia los venD. a los mayoristas que llevan a Pisco y otras veces los venD. en el Mercado Playa Grau.
DesD. que ésta en su banco comunal, su negocio ha cambiado porque con los préstamos que le dan pueD. comprar más cereales, le gusta porque a la vez pueD. ahorrar y a aprendido a ser responsable y puntual.
Su sueños es que su  negocio crezca.
texts.en:
54-year old Gertrudis is a member of the Cusi Urpi community bank. She is married and has seven children. Gertrudis earns her living buying and selling cereal grains; she is seeking a loan to buy grains at wholesale prices.

Her mother-in-law taught Gertrudis about selling cereals. She collects the grains before selling them to wholesalers who take them to Pisco. Other times she sells them at the Playa Grau market.

Since she has been a member of the bank, her business has changed. With the loans she has been able to buy more cereals, allowing her to both save money and learn how to be responsible and punctual. Gerturdis’s dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal cusi Urpi, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos. El prestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, coca.
Rufina es Feriante, trabaja en la ferias los sábados y domingos, ella venD. ahí abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros a la vez lo surte con verduras, frutas y coca.
El sueño D. Rufina es que crezca su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the Cusi Urpi community bank. She is 67 years old and has seven children. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy general supplies like fruit, vegetables, coca leaves etc. Rufina has a stall and works in the markets at weekends. She sells groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles as well as vegetables, fruit, and coca leaves.

Rufina’s dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. is a 33-year-old married man who has two children. He operates a retail shop in the Marereni area of Malindi town. He was introduced to KADET Limited by one of the company’s existing clients.

He has applied for a second loan of 68,000 KES and he plans to expand his business with it by buying more stock and repairing his business premises.  James hopes that, by doing this, his business will grow and he will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support his family as well as being able to own a flourishing business premises.

loans.use: To buy more stock like sugar and rice and repair the business premises

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Mercy  has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Mercy sells her products in a shop on a  retail basis.

Mercy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice and beef.  The main business challenges for Mercy include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel.

Mercy lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava rice and beef.

loans.name: Jean Chepngetich

texts.en:
Jean Chepngetich is 25 years old, married to Moses Kigen, and they have one child.  Jean has been in a salon business for a period of one year and her monthly income is 28,000 KES. Her business is in Tambach town and most of her clients are from the town and the surrounding area.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI and has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES which she intends to use as follows: pay rent worth 2,000 KES, buy cosmetics for 6,000 KES, dryer worth 12,000 KES, blow dryer worth 4,000 KES, and buy ribbons for 4,000 KES.    

The anticipated profits from the salon will be used to expand the salon and open other branches. This being her first loan, Jean hopes that it will increase  her profits, thus fulfilling her dreams to build her own home in the near future and own a Range Rover.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase more stock for the salon and to pay rent

loans.name: Matiri Bakyara Kweterana Group-Kyenjojo

texts.en: R. Obadiah, 45 years old, has been selling dry maize, beans and Irish potatoes in Kawaruju market-Kyenjojo to make ends meet for the last 5 years. It is a highly lucrative business that he says he began out of his own enterprise. The crops he sells are high favor delicacies in most parts of Uganda and Obadiah says he does not have any regrets as to why he began this agro produce sales business. Obadiah comes across as a humorous, strong-willed and warm gentleman. He is happily married with 7 children who all go to school. He also has a modest cattle sales enterprise. He says this business generates him weekly profits of 30,000 UGX. With this loan, he plans to buy more crops to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crops such as potatoes, beans, etc.

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “16 DE JULIO” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está integrada por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de mantas y frazadas, venta de medias, venta de condimentos, venta de flores, venta de adornos, tienda de barrio, tienda de Internet.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora E. tiene un hogar consolidado, casada, madre de cinco hijos,  tres mujeres y dos varones.  Con respecto al negocio, la señora E. produce y vende flores.  Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre hace más de veinte años atrás. La señora E. indica que compra flores que llegan al Mercado Rodríguez, pero que también trae flores que ella ha sembrado en los Yungas, para vender. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “16 DE JULIO” ["July 16"] communal bank is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, at the Santiago II community office. It is made up of nine members. The executive board is composed of the president, treasurer and recording secretary. The businesses they pursue are varied: selling blankets and bedspreads; selling condiments; selling flowers; selling decorative items; running a neighborhood store; and operating an Internet café. 

In the case of the president, E., she has a stable household and is married with five children, three girls and two boys. With respect to her business, E. produces and sells flowers. She learned this profession from her mother more than 20 years ago. E. reports that she buys flowers which are brought to the Rodríguez Market, but she also sells flowers that she has grown in the Yungas [a forested area of Bolivia] to sell. 
When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings.

loans.use: Buying arapando, iris, nard and daffodil flowers and seeds

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista E. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Teopista lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

Teopista has operated a business selling food at the market for 10 years, and she works 6 days each week. Teopista has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and onions. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Teopista are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start going to farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and onions

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
A. Adrine has been selling bananas for the last 8 years in Rukungiri Market. According to her, this has been a reliable means of livelihood for her and her family, despite occasional setbacks. The business generates 260,000 UGX monthly and she will use this loan to buy more bananas for resale.

Adrine's diligence and conviction that she can succeed in the face of problems have kept her and her business afloat. She also ekes out side profits from a firewood and alcohol sales business. Adrine is happily married with 3 children.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans).     Sarah has a takeaway food business.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Sarah sells her products from home by means of retail.  

Sarah has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken, cooking oil, and onions.  The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and the rainy season.  Her aspiration for her business is to own a fully stocked hotel.  

Sarah lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and rent.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, beef, chicken, cooking oil, and onions

loans.name: Jimmy Edgar

texts.es: Cliente Vive en Parcona en la casa de sus Padres es soltero no tiene carga familiar tiene su transporte una Mototaxi quien lo maneja y le ayuda su hermano por que tiene negocio de carpinteria junto con su papa y hermanos su taller lo tiene en su mismo domicilio.Tiene endeudamiento a la fecha con Bco Crediscotia que fue para la Mototaxi le faltan dos cuotas para cancelar gracias a su trabajo de carpintero ha podido pagar la Moto y ahorrar.El es Buena Persona le ayuda a sus Padres  en los gastos de la Casa No tiene carga familiar.Tiene aspiraciones a tener su propio negocio necesita el credito para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Jimmy Edgar lives in Parcona in his parent's house.   He is single and has no dependents.  He has a mototaxi that he drives, and he also helps his brother with his carpentry business.  His brothers and his father have a carpentry workshop that is located in the home where he lives.  Jimmy currently has a loan from Banco Crediscotia that he used for his mototaxi.  He only has 2 more payments on that loan, thanks to his carpentry work, which allowed him to pay for the mototaxi and save.  He is a good person who helps his parents with the household expenses.  He aspires to have his own business, and he needs this loan to invest in his business.

loans.use: to invest in his business.

loans.name: Retamitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “RETAMITAS” iniciará su  tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de chamarras, costuras y cueron, artesanía, venta de comida, sastrería y costura, costura, venta de chamarras, confección de polleras.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Alicia tiene un hogar consolidado, casada, madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya han dejado el hogar para conformar los propios.  Con respecto al negocio, la señora Alicia tiene el negocio de costura junto con su esposo, elabora trajes a pedido.  Ella aprendió este oficio de su esposo hace muchos años atrás, en sus propias palabras ella dice: “mi esposo me ha enseñado todo”. La señora Alicia indica que con el crédito comprará tela por mayor de la Ciudad de La Paz, de las tiendas mayoristas. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “RETAMITAS” Communal Bank is initiating its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer at the Santiago II Central Office.  The bank is composed of 9 members.  The board of directors includes a president, treasurer, and secretary.  The businesses they are involved in are varied: selling leather jackets, custom-made dresses, leather items, making skirts, selling artisan crafts, meals, plus seamstress work, and making skirts.

In the case of the president, Alicia is married, has consolidated a home, and is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom have already left home to form their own.  With respect to her business, Alicia, along with her husband, operates a tailor shop.  They make suits to order.  Alicia learned this trade from her husband many years back.  She says, in her own words: “My husband has taught me everything.”  Alicia indicates that the loan will be used to buy cloth from wholesalers in the city of La Paz.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia says that she likes receiving credit.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH AT WHOLESALE FOR MAKING SUITS TO ORDER

loans.name: Rommel Hernán

texts.es:
Rommel Hernán G. Q. tiene 33 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Rommel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y remodelar la casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Rommel Hernán G. Q. is 33 years old.  He is married, and lives with his wife and child.  He lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar province.  He has one son.

The members of the rural communal bank "Yagui Grande" live 30 minutes from the San Miguel office, in the canton of San Miguel.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who do short cycle cultivation of corn and potatoes.  They have a lot of experience in this line of work.

Rommel is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel, and sells his crops in the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He requests a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to get the supplies he needs.  Farmers in this area face challenges such as pests and diseases and climatic changes.  His dream is to buy a car and renovate his house.

He enjoys sports and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jinja Central-Jinja Group

texts.en:
N. Florence, a 39-year-old  married woman with 4 kids, says her new shoes business has now lasted 8 years. Jinja Central Market is the place she has been running it from. She has a variety of clients ranging from students, business people, to middle class women.   This business, which she began with profits from her earlier retail trading, generates 100,000 Shillings weekly.

Friends and relatives describe Florence as ambitious and foresighted. Florence makes common cause with the Jinja Central Group, and with this loan she wants to purchase more shoes to resell.

loans.use: The purchase for shoes to resell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago A. C. tiene 51 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa y arreglar el vehiculo.

Le gusta pasar con la familia y dedicarse al trabajo.
texts.en:
Santiago A. C. is 51 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their five children. They live in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolivar.

The members of the Yagui Grande communal bank are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office, in the canton of San Miguel. This local bank is made up of farmers doing short-cycle agriculture, mostly growing corn and potatoes. They all have been doing this for a long time.

Santiago grows corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them and the San Miguel market on Thursdays. He is seeking this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers. This will help him to supply the necessities for his family. He faces many challenges with his work, such as insects, diseases, and the variability of weather. 

Santiago’s dream is to build a house and fix his vehicle. He enjoys going out with his family and working.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Darung Deyvis

texts.es: DARUNG tiene 23 años es soltero vive en casa de su madre , se dedica a trabajar hace mas de 2 años al transporte a la fecha tiene una mototaxi propia que  maneja, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y experiencia crediticia , solicita s/1,500*12 TEA 42.58% dicho crédito es para  mantenimiento de su movilidad, se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago para asumir esta nueva obligacion financiera.
texts.en:
Darung is 23 years old, is single, and lives in his mother’s house. For the last two years, he has worked in transportation. Right now, he has his own mototaxi that he drives. He has good personal references and borrowing experience. 

This loan is for the maintenance of his vehicle. He is willing and able to assume this new financial responsibility.

loans.use: Maintenance of his mototaxi.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel C.
texts.en: Manuel C.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Adrine Molly

texts.en:
39-year-old A. Molly Adrine has been selling bananas for the past 5 years in Nyakachwamba Market-Rukungiri. She says she was motivated into this business by the experiences of other business women around her neighborhood who were driving successful trades selling bananas. Bananas are highly popular in Western Uganda and recently, the craze has caught up in other parts of Uganda. She says her first business venture was selling second hand shoes. She says with hard work, couragement and perseverance, she has made success something within her grasp. 

Molly is happily married with 4 kids.  She says with this loan she is going to improve her banana plantations through the purchase and application of high-grade manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers banana plantations

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Miraflores, de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene una hija de 6 años, es soltera; la señora es empleada de un estudio jurídico, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en el pago de matrícula a la Universidad para continuar sus estudios.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rocio lives in her parents' home in the Miraflores district of the city of La Paz.  She has a 6 year-old daughter and is single.  She works in a law firm and supports herself with the income she makes.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Rocio's loan will be used to pay her university registration fees so that she can continue her studies.

The socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies her to receive a loan.

loans.use: To pay her university registration fees so that she can continue her studies

loans.name: Alba Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ALBA II” iniciará su  tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de frazadas, venta de ropa, venta de dulce, venta de conservas, pasanacu, bazar, venta de cosméticos, venta de conservas, venta de licores y dulces, producción de gallinas.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Jhaneth  tiene el negocio de venta de ropa desde hace tres años, realiza sus ventas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el tipo de garantía con la que se otorga el crédito, es decir la garantía solidaria, mancomunada e indivisible.
texts.en:
The ALBA II community bank is beginning its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has ten members.  The executive committee is made up of a president, treasurer and secretary.  The members' businesses are varied: selling blankets, selling clothes, selling sweet treats, selling jams, 'pasanacu' (community solidarity fund), store, selling cosmetics, selling jams, selling liquor, selling sweet treats and raising chickens.

Jhaneth, the group's president, has had a business selling clothes for three years.  She makes her sales in the '16 de Julio' district market.

When we ask Jhaneth what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the type of guarantee with which the loans are awarded, that is to say a mutually-binding, joint and indivisible guarantee.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila, de 34 años, convive con Francisco, de 38 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos todos ellos menores de edad. En unión familiar viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Está hermosa mujer, todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde no solo siembra café, también maíz, caigua y un poco de fréjol, gracias a los constantes cuidados que le brinda todas las mañanas ella, logró tener una buena producción; los cuales constantemente comercializa a la asociación de agricultores que formaron en su localidad. Ya tienen 18 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y en todo esté tiempo sus ganancias le permitieron adquirir muchas cosas. Es por eso que ahora, quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, y está segura que lo logrará cuando extienda sus cultivos. Esté es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como fiscal de su banco comunal, asegura que velará por la honradez y el trabajo.
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 2 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en su producción de café.
texts.en:
Petronila, 34, lives with Francisco, 38.  They have five minor children.  They live together as a family in their own house located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (Peruvian central jungle).

This beautiful woman heads out to her farmlands every morning where she not only grows coffee but also corn, caigua (vine with edible fruit) and a small amount of broad beans.  Thanks to the constant care she provides every morning she obtained a good harvest which she always sells to the farmer’s associations that have been organized in her area.

She has been farming for 18 years now and during all that time profits from her work have made it possible for her to acquire many things.  This is why she now wants to improve her quality of life and is sure she will be able to do so when she enlarges her crops.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  As Fiscal Overseer of her communal bank she assures that she will watch over its honesty and the work.

She will use the requested loan to buy two sacks of organic manure to spread on her coffee crops.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
La señora Ginelba  vive en casa de su madre en anticretico en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta casada, tiene dos hijos, la actividad que realiza es la venta de CDs. El esposo trabaja  con un taxi como chofer asalariado.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para comprar más CDs y de esta manera mantener su negocio estable.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ginelba lives in her mother’s house under the anticrético modality (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  She is married and has two children.  She sells CDs and her husband works as a salaried taxi driver.

The loan she’s requesting is to increase capital to buy more CDs in order to keep her business stable.

She is an Impro client and pays back very well so is qualified to get a new loan.

loans.use: To buy CDs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo vive en anticretico en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz esta casado y tiene tres hijos; es poseedor de un vehiculo (Taxi) con el cual trabaja todos los días generando ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor de su vehiculo y de esta manera mantener estable sus ingresos y dar una mejor vida a su familia.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives under the anticrético modality (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  He is married and has three children.  He has a taxi that he works in every day generating income.

He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle’s motor so that he can keep his source of income stable and provide a better life for his family.

He is a good paying client of Impro and his socioeconomic profile qualifies his for a loan.

loans.use: To pay repair costs for his taxi's motor.

loans.name: Yhonny

texts.es:
El señor Yhonni vive en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; esta casado y tiene un hijo; es dueño de un auto con el cual trabaja todos los días en transporte libre de pasajeros, con el cual genera sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor y mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Yhonni lives in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  He’s married and has a son.  He owns a vehicle that he works with daily providing public transportation services which is his source of income to support his family.

He will use the requested loan to buy a motor to keep his work tool in good working order.

His socioeconomic profile qualifies him for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 34 años, convive con Teófilo, de 48 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Sherly, de 16 y Robert, de 13 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. El tejido de sábanas, chompas, ponchos y tapices. Es su principal actividad, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a este oficio, que le da muy buenas ganancias, ya que después de culminar sus tejidos los comercializa en la ciudad de La Oroya, Cerro de Pasco, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Según cuenta la habilidad que adquirió en el tejido, le permiten acabar 2 sábanas a la semana. Verónica se siente satisfecha con los logros que está alcanzando, ya que ayuda económicamente a su esposo Teófilo, el que se dedica al trasporte público. Ahora ella, está planeando adquirir un nuevo telar (instrumento que le permite tejer), para poder tejer en mayores cantidades. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como buena socia de su banco comunal, siente que tiene que trabajar arduamente, para poder sacar adelante a su familia y a su organización. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 70 libras de lana de colores y sintético, asimismo comprará hilo de algodón, que sirve para tejer sábanas.
texts.en:
Verónica, 34, lives with Teófilo, 48.  They have two children: Sherly, 16, and Robert, 13.  They live together in family unity in their own house located in San Pedro de Cajas.  Her main activity is weaving sheets, sweaters, ponchos and tapestries.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  It provides good profits because when she completes items she sells them in the cities of La Oroya and Cerro de Pasco where she goes twice a month.

According to what she relates, her weaving skills allow her to finish two sheets per week.  Verónica feel very satisfied with her accomplishments to date because she is able to help Teófilo, who is in public transportation, economically.

She is now planning to acquire a new loom (a tool that allows her to weave) in order to weave more quantity.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and, as a good member of her communal bank, she believes that she has to work hard to move her family and her organization ahead.

She will use the requested loan to buy 70 pounds of colored wool and synthetics as well as cotton thread that’s used to weave sheets.

loans.use: To buy 70 pounds of colored wool and synthetic fabric as well as cotton thread to weave bedsheets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su hijo; la actividad que realiza es el flete de joyas a las señoras que bailan en las fiestas tradicionales, pero con sus ahorros instalo una pequeña tienda donde puso dos puntos de llamadas telefónicas, con cuyos ingresos complementa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más joyas y no perder clientela.


Es cliente de Impro desde noviembre del 2009 y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alicia lives in her own house in La Paz’s Villa Nuevo Potosí zone with her son.

Her business is renting jewelry to the women who dance at traditional festivals.  She used her savings to set up a small store where she installed telephone services to earn extra income.

She will use the requested loan to increase her capital to buy more jewels so as not to lose customers.

She has been an Impro client since 2009 and she pays well.  Therefore, she can have access to a new loan.

loans.use: To buy more jewels to rent to the women who dance at traditional festivals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene un hijo y el esposo trabaja en el interior como empleado, ella trabaja en una funeraria donde le pagan comisiones por ventas. Ella vende repuestos para movilidades en una pequeña tienda que instalo en su casa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más repuestos para su tienda.

Es cliente antigua desde el año 2006 y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Betty lives in her in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.  She’s married and has a son.  Her husband is a salaried employee in the interior of the country.  She works at a funeral parlor and is paid a commission on sales. She also sells vehicle replacement parts in a small store she set up at home.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital buying more replacement parts for her store.

She’s a longstanding client since 2006 and pays very well.  Therefore, she can access a new loan.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela vive en  la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, soltera, no tiene hijos; es dueña de un micro (movilidad tipo van de transporte de pasajeros) con el cual genera sus ingresos, para su educación, alimentación y algunos otros gastos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar repuestos y mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gisela lives in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  She does not have any children.  She owns a micro (a type of van used to transport passengers) that generates income for her education, food and some other expenses.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy replacement parts and to service the vehicle.

She is an Impro client and pays well so may access a new loan.

loans.use: For replacement parts and maintenance of her microbus.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: tres señoras son comerciantes de queso, una tiene una heladería, dos señoras venden verduras, una vende ropa de segunda mano, uno es ayudante de una fábrica de ladrillo y una fabrica ladrillos.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Nora esta casada es madre de cinco hijos, tiene el negocio de venta de Queso desde hace diez años, realiza sus ventas en la Ciudad de La Paz y en la Ciudad de El Alto.   Ella compra el queso de la provincia Ingavi y de la localidad de Viacha.   Ha elegido este negocio por que ha evidenciado que se recupera el capital con facilidad y la ganancia es considerable. Actualmente sus hijos le ayudan en la venta de los quesos.
texts.en:
The community bank "Sembradoras" will start its first loan cycle with field partner Pro Mujer at the Regional Office in Villa Exaltacion. This group is made up of eight members. The board is composed of the president, treasurer and recording secretary. They have a variety of businesses: three women sell cheese, one has an ice cream parlor, two women sell vegetables, one sells second-hand clothes, one is an assistant in a brick factory and one makes bricks. 

Nora, the president, is a married mother of five children and has had her business selling cheese for ten years. She makes her sales in the city of La Paz and the city of El Alto. She buys the cheese from the province of Ingavi and the town Viacha. She chose this business because she has seen that she can recover capital easily and her profits are considerable. Currently her children help with her cheese sales.

loans.use: Purchase cheese.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 47-year-old Juakali (informal sector) artisan. He repairs gutters, jikos (cookers), and other metalic household items. His business, "Stage Workshop", is located in Kiambu. He is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy raw materials such as metal sheets. He also does dairy farming for extra income. 

Joseph is married and a father of two children who are in school. In five years time, he plans to be an established dairy farmer.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as metal sheets

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi is 31-years-old and is in business. He operates an electronics business in a very conducive environment. He has been operating this business for six years. He is a member of Sparks SHG and the group has guaranteed him a loan of 50,000 Kes to add stocks of televisions and DVD players. He was a security guard in the past and then began this business.  

He is married and is a father of four, two of them are in school. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Lawi has developed a savings culture and financial empowerment.

loans.use: To add stocks of televisions and DVD players

loans.name: Fernando Gualberto

texts.es:
Fernando Gualberto F. F. tiene 29 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta pasar con la familia y dedicarse al trabajo y el deporte
texts.en:
Fernando Gualberto F. F. is 29 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) of the Bolivar province. He has two children. 

The V.R.C. Yagui Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office which belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group is dedicated to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Fernando dedicates himself to farming corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. His dream is to be able to build a home. 

He likes to spend time with his family and to dedicate himself to work and sports.

loans.use: Agriculture supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mercedes Beatriz

texts.es:
Mercedes Beatriz Q. C. tiene 36 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas patronales junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes Beatriz Q. C. is 36 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) in the Boliver province. She has four children. 

The V.R.C. Yaguie Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office and belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group dedicates itself to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Mercedes dedicates herself to farming corn and potatoes. She buys her products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help her economically to provide for her necessities. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. Her dream is to be able to build a home. 

She likes to celebrate the holiday festivities with her family.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 29-year-old married lady. She is a mother of one school-going child. She describes herself as smart and hopes to do international business in the future. In five years time, she hopes to be in a position to distribute garments  wholesale. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to import African wear (kitenge) and mens clothes from Tanzania and Uganda.  Her business, "GG Boutique", is now five years old.  It is set up in a residential estate where the flow of customers is good. She is a member of Joy SHG and the group has guaranteed her loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Galo Wilfrido

texts.es:
Galo Wilfrido G. Q. tiene 28 años. Es Soltero, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Galo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.

Galo Wilifrido G. Q. is 28 years old. He is single and lives in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) in the Bolivar province. He does not have any children. 

The V.R.C. Yaguie Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office and belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group dedicates itself to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Galo dedicates himself to farming corn and potatoes. He buys her products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. His dream is to be able to build a home. 

He likes sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Segundo Pablo

texts.es:
Segundo Pablo V. N. tiene 52 años. Es casada, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Pablo V. N. is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) in the Bolivar province. He has five children. 

The V.R.C. Yaguie Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office and belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group dedicates itself to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Segundo dedicates himself to farming corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. His dream is to be able to build a home. 

He likes sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: San Juanita

texts.es: La Sra. S. es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchista ella tiene dos hijos y son ellos los que hacen que nunca se canse de seguir adelante, en este momento esta separada de su esposo pero ellos siguen en comunión al pendiente de la educacion de los hijos que aun los unen ya tiene mucho tiempo dedicandose ha elaborar arreglos para fiestas lo cual le gusta mucho en este momento ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segundo uso el cual le ha estado funcionando muy bien es por eso que quiere invertirle para mejorar sus ganacias en ambos negocios.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a hardworking, tenacious woman.  She has two children and they are the reason why she never tires of struggling to get ahead.
She is currently separated from her husband but they still are in communication with each other watching over the education of their children that still hold them together.

She has worked making party decorations for a long time now.  She enjoys her work very much.  She also has a used clothes business currently that is doing quite well so she wants to invest in it to improve her profits in both businesses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Segundo Nicolás

texts.es:
Segundo Nicolás A. C. tiene 48 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Nicolás A. C., 48, is married and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The members of the YAGUI GRANDE communal bank are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office.  It is part of San Miguel canton and the bank is dedicated to short cycle farming (maize and potatoes).  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Segundo farms maize and potatoes.  He buys his supplies in Ambato and San Miguel and sells his crops in San Miguel’s Thursday market.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his maize and potato crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and climactic variations.  His dream is to be able to build a house.

He enjoys sports and family outings.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) operator in Kiambu. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a motorcycle for his business. He has been operating this business for two years in a very good environment. He is a member of Kagwe Faith SHG and the group has guaranteed his loan. David is also employed in a tea factory. He is very hardworking and hopes to own a motorbike taxi firm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gustavo Nicasio

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo Nicasio P. y su esposa Hilda Karina, son una pareja de esposos jovenes que tienen un hijo pequeño, y ellos adquirieron su vivienda a traves de Infonavit, pero como es una colonia que está a las afueras de la ciudad, ellos se quieren proteger de la inseguridad, tanto para ellos como para su hijo,  y estan haciendo todo lo posible por cercar la casa alrededor, y tener mas privacidad, ellos están  terminando de construir la barda del patio trasero que es donde les preocupa más, ya que su hija en ocasiones anda jugando,y los vecinos le avientan piedras o hacen travesuras, y además de no tener privacidad les ensucian su patio, ya están cansados de tanta travesura, y han decidido levantar la barda trasera lo mas rápido posible, por este motivo ellos se acercaron a solicitar el crédito y llevar a cabo este proyecto, y sentir más seguridad y respeto para la familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo Nicasio P. and his wife Hilda Karina are a young couple with a small child. They acquired their home through Infonavit in a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city. They want to protect themselves and their child from the lack of security in the neighborhood and are doing everything possible to enclose the outside of the house.

Right now, they are finishing the construction of a fence in the rear of the house. This is the area they are most worried about, as their child plays there and sometimes the neighbors throw stones or cause mischief. They have no privacy on their patio and are tired of the situation, so they have decided to put up the fence as quickly as possible.

For this reason, they are soliciting this loan to complete the project. Then they will feel more secure and respected as a family.

loans.use: Build a fence in rear of house

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: EL SR. Rogelio P. y su esposa Cynthia Lizbeth Fuentes son una pareja joven que esperan a su primer bebe, ellos tienen la ilusion de recibirlo con muchas comodidades, pero ahora es imposible ya que viven en casa de los Padres de Rogelio, quienes los estan apoyando  tanto economicamente, como  moralmente, y desean que Rogelio adquiera responsabilidades como nuevo Papa y empieze a responsabilizarse de obligaciones nuevas que contraera al venir el bebe es por esto que se interesaron en adquirir el credito, y asi poder comprar la Cuna que tanto han deseado ya que estan esforzandose dia a dia, por ser mejores como personas y prometen ser muy responsables con la familia en el Futuro. Asi como en las Responsabilidades adquiridas .
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio Pérez and his wife, Cynthia Lizbeth Fuentes, are a young couple expecting their first baby.  Their hope is to welcome the baby with many comforts.  However, that’s currently impossible because they live in Rogelio’s parents’ house that support them both economically and emotionally.  

They want Rogelio to take on his new responsibilities that will come with fatherhood and to face the new obligations he’ll have with the baby’s arrival. This is why they were interested in his acquiring a loan to buy the crib they want so much since they are making the effort every day to be better people.

They pledge to be very responsible with the family in the future as well as with the acquired obligations.

loans.use: To buy a crib for the baby that's on the way.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old. He runs a bodaboda (motor cycle transport) business in Nairobi. This business is two years old and he employs one person. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to repair his motorcycles. He was previously operating a transport business with a bicycle.
