He is married and hopes to have a matatu (a van for transporting people) in the future. In five years time, James hopes to divest into real estate. Through Faulu Kenya loans, James has acquired a motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair motorcycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for school/tuition

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es: Rosmira Chávez es una mujer de 44 años que vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15, 21 y 24 años que inició el negocio de miscelánea , desde muy joven cuando apenas estudiaba técnicas para hacer muñecos de trapo, en una pequeña mesa en su casa donde exhibía para la venta de estudiantes y amas de casa, las muñecas productos de su aprendizaje, cuadernos, colores, lápices, sacapuntas , en fin todo a buen precio. Poco a poco su negocio aumentó, y así mismo sus clientes y fue agregando una a una de las vitrinas que tiene y así mismo empezó a estudiar en un centro de capacitación formación técnica para aprender diversas técnicas que a ella le gustaban , así fue como hizo el curso de confección de ropa intima, manejo de maquinas planas  y modistería en general y una vez aprendió se fue a trabajar  en un taller donde perfeccionó sus arte, pero aun seguía teniendo las vitrinas en casa ayudada por su familia, con ello apoyó mucho la gestión del hogar, especialmente en lo relacionado al estudio de sus hijos;  hoy se siente satisfecha de sus logros, pero con el firme propósito de seguir creciendo personalmente y también de continuar  fortaleciendo su emprendimiento. Este es su primer financiamiento el cual aplicará a su microempresa  hoy llamada “Variedades Rosmy” , que se ha especializado en la venta de cerámicas, muñequería, papelería, e insumos de la confección; con su credikiva comprará materiales para elaborar muñecas de trapo, , cerámicas alusivas a la navidad y también se preparará para la época escolar del mes de Enero,  e invertirá en papelerías. Su gran sueño es lograr algún día exportar las muñecas de trapo que ella fabrica con sus manos,  para sentirse feliz cuando a cualquier parte del mundo alegre la vida de un niño  con una hermosa muñeca, que es  algo de si misma y que fabrica con mucho amor
texts.en:
Rosmira Chávez is a 44 year-old woman who lives in Simón Bolívar neighborhood with her husband and three children aged 15, 21 and 24.  She started her business when she was very young.  She studied techniques for making rag dolls on a small table in her home and displayed the dolls for sale to students and housewives together with exercise books, pencils and pencil sharpeners, all at a good price.

Little by little Rosmira's business increased as did her customers and she added the display cases she now has one by one.  She also studied at a technical training center, learning a number of techniques which she liked.  She did a course on making underwear, using sewing machines and dressmaking in general and when she'd finished learning she went to work in a workshop where she perfected her art.  She still had her display cases in her house, however, helped by her family.  She managed to support her household very well in this way, especially as regards her children's studies.  She currently she feels very satisifed with her achievements but she fully intends to continue growing as a person and she wants to continue strengthening her business.

This is Rosmira's first loan and she will use it in her small business which is called “Variedades Rosmy” and specializes in selling ceramics, dolls and accessories, stationery and dressmaking supplies.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy materials to make rag dolls and Christmas-decorated ceramics.  She will also prepare for the back-to-school period in January and will invest in stationery products.  Her big dream is to some day manage to export her hand-made rag dolls.  She will feel happy when in some part of the world a little child's life becomes brightened as they receive a beautiful doll which is something she made herself with a lot of love.

loans.use: To buy materials for making rag dolls, Christmas-decorated ceramics and also to prepare for the back-to-school period in January

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for his business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 47 years old and married with two school-going children.  She sells curtains and bed covers in a residential area. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy more curtains and bed covers. This loan is guaranteed by New Generation SHG where Rose is a member. Her business is three years old and she hopes to own a business premise of her own in five years. She describes herself as hardworking and friendly.

loans.use: To buy curtains and bed covers to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 37 años, convive con Janet, de 27 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ángelo, de 12 y Denis, de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). La siembra de café, caigua y plátanos, es su principal actividad económica. Ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Su objetivo, es lograr obtener un café de buena calidad, ya está trabajando en ello, sus cultivos de café que cada día son mejores, los comercializa en la asociación de agricultores de su localidad, pero en época de campaña agrícola, acopia el café de los demás agricultores, y los comercializa en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Pero Juan, también se dedica a la producción de CD, y DVD industriales, cada año en el mes de diciembre, viaja a la capital del país, para trabajar en la producción de los mismos. Ahora, él quiere incursionar en la crianza de cuyes, los que en la actualidad tienen mayor demanda. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como secretario de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho por el trabajo conjunto que realizan constantemente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 50 cuyes, que cuestan 20 soles cada uno, asimismo invertirá en la construcción de la granja donde los criará.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old.  He lives with 27 year-old Janet.  They have two children: 12 year-old Ángel and 7 year-old Denis.  They live in their own home in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).  Juan's main business activity is growing coffee, 'caigua' (a type of native cucumber) and bananas.  He has been farming for 3 years. His goal is to obtain a good-quality coffee.  He is already working on this.  His coffee crops are better every day.  He sells them in the Farmers Association in his district but during the farming season he also harvests the coffee of other farmers and sells it in the city of Villa Rica.

Juan also makes industrial CDs and DVDs.  Every year in the month of December he travels to the country's capital to work on their production.  Now he would also like to break into the business of raising guinea pigs which are in high demand right now.

This is Juan's fourth loan from MFP and, as secretary of his community bank, he feels satisfied with the joint work that his group is constantly doing.  He will use his loan to buy 50 guinea pigs which cost 20 Peruvian soles each.  He will also invest in building a farm where he can raise them.

loans.use: To buy 50 guinea pigs and material to build a farm for these animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To kit out her hairdressing salon with new chairs and hairdressing capes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber, varnish and nails

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Común mente vemos historias de personas emprendedoras y con mucho positivismo para los negocios, pero en este caso esta historia es de una joven estudiante con muchos deseos se surgir, con estudios que en el futuro le aseguren un puesto de trabajo y así desempeñarse en un ámbito laboral estable. Este es el caso de Rosa Díaz de 21 años de edad, ella radica en el distrito del Agustino y vive en casa de sus padres los cuales le dan todo el apoyo necesario para salir adelante en los estudios. Rosa Díaz estudia prótesis dental en el I.S.T de la Clínica Ricardo Palma, ya está a puertas de terminar sus estudios y finalizándolos desea ejercerlo con empeño y dedicación, en el futuro tiene pensado especializar su carrera y poder tener su propio consultorio dental y así surgir económicamente y darse un estilo de vida estable. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de titulación, el cual le es un poco costoso. No puedo concluir sin antes mencionar el empeño y deseo de superación de Rosa Díaz para salir adelante y abrirse paso entre tanta competitividad que hoy en día hay.
texts.en:
We often see stories of enterprising people with a lot of enthusiasm for their businesses but in this case the story is of a young student who has a great desire to get ahead in her studies which will assure her of a job in the future and enable her to work in a stable working environment.

Rosa Díaz is 21 years old.  She is from Agustino district and lives at home with her parents who give her all the support necessary to get ahead in her studies.  Rosa Díaz is studying dentistry in the Higher Technological Institute of the Ricardo Palma Clinic.  She has almost completed her studies and when she does finish she would like to carry out her profession with determination and commitment.  In the future she is thinking of specializing and owning her own dental clinic so that she can do well financially and give herself a stable lifestyle.

Rosa will use this loan to pay her graduation fees which are a little expensive.  We cannot conclude this story without mentioning the determination and desire which Rosa Díaz has to get ahead and make her way in life among all the competitiveness that exists these days.

loans.use: To pay her graduation fees

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Latinas" consists of seven women and one man, although the name means ¨Latina Women."  Magaly, pictured in the second row in the middle, is the group's new president.  She has been with the group for more than a year.
 
Magaly sells beauty products from catalogues to her friends and neighbors.  She is 34 years old and lives with her two children and husband in Carabayllo, north of Lima.  Now that the holiday season has arrived, she wants to increase her inventory to better serve her customers.  Magaly is also planning to stock up on panetón (Peruvian fruitcake) to sell to her customers.  

In the future, Magaly would like to have her business in a proper shop instead of out of her home, but for now she is content to simply increase her sales.  


*** The woman in the red shirt is Mrs. Zoila Rosa S. O., who is a member of the group but is not taking out a loan in this loan cycle. 

*** La señora que aparece de blusas a rayas es la Señora Rosa Petronila V. M.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta, de 43 años, convive con Gilber, de 45 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos, en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Está hermosa mujer, se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra café, en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Cuenta que ahora está haciendo viveros de café, para poder renovar sus plantaciones; ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Y lo que más le gusta a ella es poder cuidar de sus sembríos, pues cuenta que en épocas de invierno, “la chupadora de café” (un tipo de mosquito que invade los cultivos) invade sus plantaciones impidiéndole crecer con mayor rapidez. Pero el constante asesoramiento que recibe de la asociación de agricultores donde comercializa sus granos, le ayudan a producir. Ahora le enseñaron a sembrar de manera ordenada utilizando rectas y líneas a nivel. Por ello más adelante desea seguir aplicando los métodos de cultivos que le ayuden a adquirir productos de calidad, que sean muy bien cotizados. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, está dichosa por el apoyo que recibe constantemente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en sus terrenos de cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Marta is 43 years old.  She lives with her partner, 45 year-old Gilber.  They have 4 children but only live with 3 of them.  They live together in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).

This beautiful woman is a farmer.  She grows coffee on her 2 hectares of agricultural land.  She tells us that she is now establishing coffee nurseries so that she can renew her plantations.  She has been farming for 20 years.  What she most likes about her work is being able to care for her crops.  She says that in the winter months, the “chupadora de café” (a type of mosquito that attacks crops) attacks her plantations, preventing her crops from growing as quickly as they could.  However, the constant advice that she receives from her Farmers' Association, where she sells her beans, helps her with her production.  They have taught her to grow in an ordered way, using straight and level lines.  In the future, she would like to continue applying the cultivation methods which will help her to acquire quality produce that are much sought after.

This is Marta's second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is fortunate that she receives constant support.  She will use her loan to buy several sacks of organic manure which she will spread on her coffee crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure for her plantations

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 37 years old and is a single mother of three school-going children. She is hardworking and determined to succeed. She runs a grocery business where she sells cabbage, sukumawiki (kales), onions, tomatoes, among other products. She wants to start selling cereals on the side and thus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy cereals, sukumawiki (kales), and tomatoes. She hopes to own a pick-up in five years for her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sukumawiki (kales), and tomatoes

loans.name: Tilman

texts.es:
Tilman R. es un hombre de 40 años que se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y almuerzos en su carruaje llamado "Comidas Rápidas los Reyes" tal como lo muestra en su fotografía; él es casado, vive en el barrio José Antonio Galán de la ciudad de Barranquilla  y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11. 15 y 16 años. Su emprendimiento lo inició hace 5 años vendiendo pizza  y gradualmente ha agregado almuerzos, comidas rápidas, bebidas, helado, carne y pollo al carbón.
Desde que está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 8 años ha recibido 10 financiamientos y el décimo es justamente su credikiva, con el cual comprará 4 juegos de sillas plásticas y materias primas e insumos para sus comidas; Con su vinculación a esta organización ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y ha construido su excelente historial crediticio. Su sueño y gran desafío es convertir su negocio en un “Restaurante 5 estrellas” reconocido en todo el Caribe Colombiano.  Tilman es un trabajador incansable,  su negocio  es exitoso en el barrio y reporta una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 28%, una liquidez de 43,3%, rentabilidad sobre la inversión es del 25%, tiene una rotación de  cuentas por cobrar de 21 días y una rotación de productos terminados de 5 días. El es fundamentalmente feliz con su familia y sueña con poder ofrecerles un gran porvenir.
texts.en:
Tilman R. is a 40 year old man who sells fast food and lunches in his food stand called "Comidas Rápidas los Reyes" [The Kings Fast Food] as is shown in the picture above. He is married and lives in the neighborhood José Antonio Galán in the city of Barranquilla. He has 3 children, ages 11, 15 and 16. He started his business 5 years ago selling pizza and has gradually added lunches, fast food, drinks, ice cream, grilled beef and chicken. 

Since he has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] for 8 years and he has received 10 loans. His tenth loan is actually a Kiva loan, with which he will buy 4 sets of plastic chairs, raw materials and supplies to make his food products. His relationship with this organization has improved his standard of living and has given him an excellent credit history. His dream and great challenge is to convert his business into a 5 star restaurant, known around the Colombian Carribean. Tilman is a tireless worker and his business is successful in the neighborhood. It has a 28% profitability on sales, a liquidity of 43.3%, a return on investment of 25%, a 21-day turnover on accounts payable, and a 5-day turnover on finished products. He is fundamentally happy with his family and dreams of being able to offer them a great future.

loans.use: Four sets of plastic chairs, raw materials and food supplies.

loans.name: Mireille P.

texts.fr: Mariée, Mireille a à charge 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle vit toujours avec ses parents depuis son mariage, il y a 14 ans et se fait aider par son mari dans les dépenses du foyer. Âgée de 33 ans, Mireille est une distributrice de divers articles tels que les sachets qu'elle vend en gros, les pagnes, les chaussures et les cartons de corn bœufs. Elle fait ses ventes au comptant et à crédit. Elle va collecter les fonds le lendemain ou la fin de la semaine. Ses clients sont constitués des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne au moins 2 fois par semaine au Togo et au Nigeria, deux pays frontaliers au Bénin. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de diversifier ses marchandises, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV dans le but de mieux satisfaire ses clients qui lui sont toujours fidèles. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra de se prendre en charge et d'aider son mari pour la scolarité des enfants. Elle souhaiterait plu tard avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en: Mireille is married and is responsible for 3 children who are in school.  She still lives with her parents since her marriage 14 years ago and her husband helps her with household expenditures.  Mireille is 33 years old and is a distributor of various goods such as packets that she sells wholesale,  cloth, shoes, and boxes of corn beef.  She sells for cash and on credit. She collects the funds the next day or at the end of the week. Her customers consist of people from her region and surrounding areas.  She stocks up at least twice a week in Togo and in Nigeria, two countries bordering Benin. To strengthen her business funds in order to diversify her merchandise, she requested and obtained a microloan from FINADEV in order to better serve her customers who are always loyal.  The extra income generated by this microloan will enable her to take charge and help her husband with their children’s schooling. At some point she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, packets, and foodstuff to stock up her store to satisfy her clients.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 42. He operates a matatu (van for transporting people) in Nairobi for a living. Business is very good during peak hours of every day, i.e. morning and evening, since everyone is going to work in the morning and leaving work for home in the evening. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to repair his matatu. He is a member of Lucky Seven SHG and the loan is guaranteed by the group. He is married and is a father of four, who are in school. He describes himself as a people person and reliable.

loans.use: To repair his matatu (van for transporting people)

loans.name: Mesias Heriberto

texts.es:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. tiene 51 años. Es viudo, vive con  los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mesias se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Mesias Heriberto V. G. is a 51-year-old widower.  He lives with his children in the San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  He has 6 children.
The members of the communal bank YAGUI GRANDE are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the San Miguel canton.  The members of this bank are short-cycle farmers of corn and potatoes and have been doing this work for a long time.
Mesias sows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in the San Miguel market on Thursdays.
He requests this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizer for the cultivation of  corn and potatoes.  This loan will help him provide household necessities.  He faces challenges from insects, diseases, and the variability of the weather.  His dream is to be able to build a house.
He enjoys sports and spending time with his children.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and feritlizer

loans.name: Leonor Amable

texts.es:
Leonor Amable E. B. tiene 36 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Leonor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
Leonor Amable E. B. is 36 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in the canton of San Miguel, Bolivar province.  She has two children.

The members of the Yagui Grande communal bank are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office, which is part of the canton of San Miguel.  This group works in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and potatoes.  They have all been doing this for a long time.

Leonor works in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes.  She buys her products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural goods and fertilizers for growing corn and potatoes.  The support provided by this loan will help her to provide for her needs.  She faces challenges like insects, plant diseases, and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to be able to build a house.

She enjoys knitting.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old. She operates Ebenezer, a business that houses several businesses like tailoring, dressmaking, and embroidery. This business is eight years old and is located in a busy environment. 

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to add stocks of fabric for 10,000 KES, a knitting machine for 10,000 KES and knitting thread for 5,000 KES. She is polite and humble and hopes to own a tailoring and dressmaking college in the future. Since joining Faulu, Rose's business has grown since Faulu has given her loans to buy machines for her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a knitting machine, and knitting thread

loans.name: Stalin Napoleon

texts.es:
Stalin Napoleon G. M. tiene 29 años.  Es Soltero, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Stalin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta pasear disfrutar de las fiestas.
texts.en:
Stalin Napoleon G. M. is 29 years old.  He is single and lives in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He doesn't have any children.

The Yagui Grande solidarity group is located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and potatoes.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Stalin is a farmer.  He grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to be able to buy his own plot of land.

He likes to go for walks and enjoy festivities.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Soliatou L. I.

texts.fr: Âgée de 33 ans, Soliatou est mariée et a 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle participe aux différentes charges du foyer. Elle a 8 ans d'expérience dans son domaine. Elle commercialise les produits alimentaires tels que les sardines, les tomates en boîtes, les boites de nescafé, les cartons de sucres, du lait en poudre ou concentré. Ses clients sont constitués des ménages de la zone et de ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne chez les grossistes à Tokpa, le plus grand marché du Bénin et au Togo ou au Nigeria, deux pays frontaliers au Bénin. Dans le souci d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et obtenu un 1er crédit à FINADEV pour bien ravitailler sa boutique en ces divers produits d'alimentation. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par le micro crédit lui permettra de mieux faire aux charges du foyer afin de faire souffler un tout petit peu son mari au foyer. Elle souhaiterait avoir sa propre maison de distribution de gros des alimentaires et avoir sa propre maison pour quitter la location.
texts.en:
Soliatou, aged 33, is married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and children who all attend school. 
She takes part in covering the family's various expenses. She has 8 years of experience in her field. She sells food products such as sardines, canned tomatoes, boxes of Nescafé (instant coffee), boxes of sugar, powdered or concentrated milk. Her client base is made up of households in the neighborhood and its outskirts. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at Tokpa, Benin’s largest market, and in Togo or Nigeria, two bordering countries. 
With the goal of better satisfying her customers, she requested and obtained a first loan from FINADEV to stock up her shop on these various food products. 
The extra income generated by the micro-loan will enable her to better meet household expenses and thus allow her husband to get a little rest at home. She would like to have her own wholesale food distribution business as well as her own house to stop renting.

loans.use: To stock up on food products (sardines, canned tomatoes, boxes of Nescafé (instant coffee), boxes of sugar, powdered or concentrated milk) to meet customer needs

loans.name: Katherine Jessenia

texts.es:
Katherine de 19 años, tiene una panadería surtida con algunos víveres de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio en una casa de cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

El negocio lo empezaron sus padres con un horno y una vitrina haciendo panes de harina juntos hace ya 18 años atrás. En el 2009 la mama de Katherine salió del país para buscar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y tuvieron que cerrar la panadería por falta de dinero. En este año Katherine y su hermana de 16 años decidieron abrir la panadería otra vez y hacer los panes que desde pequeña le enseñaron sus padres.  Le pusieron por nombre “Niño Isaac” compraron con sus ahorros harina, levaduras, lácteos y algunos víveres para surtir el lugar. Trabajan desde muy temprano haciendo los panes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, snack, lácteos para surtir su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y vender tortas, bocaditos para tener variedad.
texts.en:
Katherine, 19, has a bakery where she also stocks groceries.  She lives in an urban zone called Suburbio in a cement house that has all basic utilities.

Her parents started the business with one oven and a display case baking bread from flour together over 18 years ago.  In 2009 Katherine’s mother went abroad seeking better employment opportunities and had to close the bakery due to lack of funds.

This year Katherine and her 16 year old sister decided to reopen the baker again making the bread that their parents taught them to make when they were little girls.  They called it “Niño Isaac” and used their savings to buy flour, yeast, dairy products and a few groceries to stock in the place.  They work from very early making bread.

She wants to use the loan to buy beverages, snacks and dairy products to stock in the bakery.  In the future she’d like to expand the business selling sandwiches and fast food to have more variety.

loans.use: For dairy products and snacks.

loans.name: Ángel Miguel

texts.es:
Ángel Miguel G. P. tiene 28 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Ángel Miguel G. P. is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and child in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

The members of the community bank Yagui Grande are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the canton of San Miguel.  This group is made up of short-cycle farmers who have a lot of experience planting corn and potatoes.

Ángel is a farmer who plants corn and potatoes.  He purchases his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers to cultivate corn and potatoes.  The support of the loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like plagues, sickness, and weather changes.  His dream is to be able to build a house.

He likes to enjoy the carnaval parties.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo, de 20 años, vive con su papá Raymundo, su mamá Ida y sus 4 hermanos; en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Desde que tenía 15 años, este joven ambicioso, se dedicó a la agricultura, donde siembra rocoto, plátano y café, los que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa en la capital del país, como también en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Pero como buen hombre del campo, Reynaldo, también trabaja de peón en los demás terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan una jornada diaria, de 25 nuevos soles. Pero lo que más le gusta a él, es cuidar y mejorar su producción, por ello más adelante desea mejorar la calidad de sus sembríos en su media hectárea de terreno agrícola; esperando que, con las ganancias obtenidas pueda comprar más terrenos. “Quiero superarme, para ayudar a mi familia y ser exitoso”, afirma. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho de los logros que alcanzó, gracias al apoyo constante que recibe. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en su producción de café y caigua.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 20, lives with his father, Raymundo, his mother and his four siblings in their own house located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (Peruvian central jungle).  Since he was 15 this ambitious young man has been farming.  He grows peppers, bananas and coffee which he sells in the nation’s capital and in the city of Villa Rica after harvesting.

Like all good men of the soil, Reynaldo also works as a field hand on other farms where he earns a daily wage of 25 new soles.  However, what he most enjoys is caring for and improving his own crops.  Therefore, later on he’d like to improve the quality of his crops in his half hectare field hoping that with the profits obtained he can buy still more land.  “I want to improve myself in order to help out my family and be successful” he affirms.

This is his 2nd loan with MFP.  As a new member of the communal bank he feels satisfied with his accomplishments so far thanks to the constant support he receives.

He will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee and caigua (vine producing an edible fruit) plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Devora Odila

texts.es:
Devora Odila V. G. tiene 43 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Devora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder dar los estudios a sus hijos.

Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del Arcángel.
texts.en:
Devora Odila V. G., 43, is married living with her husband and children in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  She has 5 children.

The members of the YAGUI GRANDE communal bank are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office.  It belongs to San Miguel canton.  The bank is dedicated to activities related to short cycle farming of maize and potatoes.  They have been in this occupation for a long time.

Devora is a maize and potato farmer.  She buys her supplies in Ambato and San Miguel and sells her production at the San Miguel Thursday market.

She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her maize and potato crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather changes.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with an education.

She enjoys celebrating the Archangel’s feast days.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old. She raises dairy cows for milk and chickens for eggs. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy feeds for her animals like bran, vitamins, layers mash, growers mash, and dairy meal. She is a member of God's Favour SHG and the loan is guaranteed by the group. 

Mary is married and is a mother of five --  four of them are in school. She describes herself as hardworking and honest, and hopes to buy a pick-up truck in the future to transport her products to the market.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Laetitia S.

texts.fr: Âgée de 40 ans, Lætitia est mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Dotée d'une expérience de 9 ans en la matière, Lætitia commercialise des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes. Elle a diversifié son activité dans la vente du gari une farine locale faite à base de manioc. Sa clientèle est composée de ses riverains. Elle s'approvisionne en produits de beauté, cosmétiques et gari au Togo et au Nigeria, deux pays limitrophes au Bénin. La sollicitation de plus en plus croissante de ses clients l'oblige à faire un recours à notre institution de micro crédit FINADEV afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients fidèles. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit pourrait l'aider à améliorer la vie quotidienne de sa famille comme par exemple le confort général du foyer. Elle est a son 2ème crédit à FINADEV. Elle souhaiterait élargir son étalager et devenir une grossiste des produits de beautés dans les jours à venir.
texts.en: Lætitia is 40 years old and is the mother of four school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children. She has nine years of experience selling cosmetics and loincloth. She has expanded her business to include the sale of gari, a local flour produced from manioc. Her clientele is mostly composed of neighbors. She purchases beauty products, cosmetics and gari in Togo and Nigeria, two neighboring countries of Benin. Increasing demand from her clients has lead her to ask a loan from our micro-credit institution FINADEV to better meet the needs of her loyal clients. The additional income she will derive from this loan could help her improve the everyday life of her family by making her home more comfortable. This is her second loan from FINADEV. She would like to expand her shelving and become a beauty product wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing of beauty products, cosmetics and loincloth to meet the needs of her clientele

loans.name: Geovanny Teodomiro

texts.es:
Geovanny Teodomiro V. B. tiene 22 años. Es Soltero vive con sus padres,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Geovanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte
texts.en:
Geovanny Teodomiro V. B. is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province.  He does not have children.

He is a member of Yagui Grande communal bank, which is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in San Miguel canton.  This communal bank's members work in agriculture, growing short season corn and potatoes.  This work takes a lot of time.

Geovanny also grows corn and potatoes.  He buys products in Ambato and San Miguel, and he sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like pests, crop diseases, and changes in the weather.  His dream is to be able to buy a field.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: supplies

loans.name: Homero Gabriel

texts.es:
Homero Gabriel G. Q.  tiene 30 años. Es Soltero vive con sus padres,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Homero se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y construir una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del Patron San Miguel.
texts.en:
Homero Gabriel G. Q.  is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has one son.

He is a member of Yagui Grande communal bank, which is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in San Miguel Canton.  This bank's members work in agriculture growing short season corn and potatoes.  The work takes a lot of time to do.

Homero grows corn and potatoes.  He buys products in Ambato and San Miguel, and he sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like pests, crop diseases and weather changes.  Homero's dream is to buy a car and build a house.

He likes playing sports and celebrating the Feast of San Miguel.

loans.use: supplies

loans.name: Oswaldo Agustin

texts.es:
Oswaldo Agustin V. B. tiene 29 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del carnaval como es costumbre.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Agustin V. B. is 29 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and their son in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province.

He is a member of Yagui Grande communal bank, which is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in San Miguel Canton.  This bank's members are farmers who grow short season corn and potatoes.  The work takes a lot of time.

Oswaldo also grows corns and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel, and he sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like pests, crop diseases and weather changes.  His dream is to fix up his house.

He likes to play sports and celebrate carnival, which is a tradition here.

loans.use: Supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Frida

texts.es: Frida, de 41 años, convive con Jorge, de 31 años. Producto de su amor, nació Hade, de 2 añitos. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). La siembra de caigua, rocoto, café y plátanos, son su actividad principal. Frida ya tiene 23 años dedicándose a la agricultura, desde joven, aprovechó todo el apoyo que le brindaron sus padres, y ahora gracias a ellos tiene unos productivos terrenos agrícolas, que le brindan el sustento de cada día. Según cuenta, cuando sus cultivos de rocoto y caigua, están listos para cosechar, los comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo y en la capital del país, pero sus granos de café los comercializa en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Lo que más le gusta a ella es viajar constantemente, ya que aprende muchas técnicas de venta en cada viaje que realiza. Por ello más adelante desea abrir una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y como integrante de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan constantemente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 5 sacos de abono, para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de café, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar fertilizantes naturales para  esparcirlos en sus sembríos de caigua.
texts.en:
Frida, 41, lives with Jorge, 31.  Their love resulted in the birth of Hade, 2.  They live together as a family in their own house located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (Peruvian central jungle).

Her main activity is growing caigua (vine producing an edible fruit), rocoto (peppers), coffee and bananas.  Frida has been a farmer for 23 years now having started very young taking advantage of all the support she got from her parents.  Now, thanks to them she has productive farmland that provides her daily sustenance.

According to what she relates, when her rocoto and caigua crops are ready to harvest she sells them in the city of Huancayo and in the nation’s capital.  Her coffee beans, however, are sold in the city of Villa Rica.

What she most enjoys is the constant travel because she learns many sales techniques on each trip she makes.  This is why later on she’d like to have a grocery store where she can sell basic need items to residents of her area.

This is her 4th loan from MFP.  As a member of her communal bank she feels grateful for the constant support she’s been given.

She will use the requested loan to buy five sacks of manure to spread among her coffee plants and if the money goes far enough she will be able to buy natural fertilizers to spread on her caigua plants.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of manure and perhaps fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan Elias V. N. tiene 39 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Juan Elias V. N. is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.  He has five children.

The members of the community bank Yagui Grande are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in the canton of San Miguel.  This group is made up of short-cycle farmers who have a lot of experience growing corn and potatoes.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes.  He purchases his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  This loan will make him able to meet his needs financially.  He faces challenges like plagues, sickness, and weather changes.  His dream is to purchase land.

He likes to dance.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for corn and potato crops

loans.name: Mercedes Cristina

texts.es:
Mercedes Cristina A. C. tiene 30 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar casa.

Le gusta jugar basket y festejar las fiestas del carnaval
texts.en:
Mercedes Cristina A. C. is 30 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar department.  She has 2 children.

The Yagui Grande solidarity group is located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and potatoes.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Mercedes is a farmer.  Shee grows corn and potatoes.  She buys her products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy her own home.

Mercedes likes to play basketball and enjoy Carnival celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Leonardo Rafael

texts.es:
Leonardo Rafael V. B. tiene 29 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Leonardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro para los padres.

Le gusta hacer deporte y el carnaval.
texts.en:
Leonardo Rafael V. B. is 29 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The Yagui Grande solidarity group is located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and potatoes.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Leonardo is a farmer.  He grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a car for his parents.

He likes to take part in sports and celebrate Carnival.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, madre soltera de tres hijos, por los cuales trabaja mucho para lograr darles educación.
Hoy en día trabaja de conserje, un trabajo fijo, ya que anteriormente vendía frutas, lavaba y planchaba.
Su casa la ha venido mejorando con financiamiento que la institución ha dado. Son siete ciclos  en donde ha avanzado mucho. Con este nuevo préstamo hará un anexo en la cocina, el cual será de gran beneficio para el bienestar de su familia. los materiales a comprar serán piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas entre otros para seguir con la obra.
texts.en:
María is a woman with few economic resources. She is a single mother with three children for whom she works hard in order to succeed in giving them an education.

Currently, she works as a janitor, a steady job. Previously, she sold fruit and did laundry and ironing. She has made improvements to her house with financing that the microfinance institution has given her. In seven loan cycles she has made a lot of progress. With this new loan she will build an addition to her kitchen which will be of great benefit for the wellbeing of her family. The materials she will buy are stone, sand, cement, iron, and boards, among others, in order to continue with the project.

loans.use: She will buy construction materials in order to build an addition to her kitchen, improving the condition of her home.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 23 años, convive con Armando, de 32 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Yeiner, de 5 y Mayra, de 3 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Mientras que nos muestra la hoja de tabaco que crece en su casa. Olga, nos cuenta, que hace 7 años se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra, café y plátanos en grandes cantidades. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder ver crecer sus plantaciones sin mayores dificultades, ya que las inclemencias del tiempo, le ocasionan grandes pérdidas, pero a pesar de ello, Olga siempre sale airosa, pues el apoyo que recibió de su banco comunal, hace que pueda invertir más en el fortalecimiento de sus cultivos, a los cuales abona constantemente, y en cada cosecha los comercializa en una reconocida empresa ubicada en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Ahora, ella está pensando invertir en la apertura de una fuente de soda, en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ahí piensa vender hamburguesas, bebidas frías y dulces. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de los constantes éxitos que obtuvo gracias al apoyo que recibe. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de los materiales necesarios para abrir la fuente de soda que estaba pensando, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará bebidas y dulces.
texts.en:
Olga is 23 years old and lives with her partner, 32 year-old Armando.  They have 2 children: 5 year-old Yeiner and 3 year-old Mayra.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).

While she shows us the tobacco leaf that grows at her home, Olga tells us that she has been farming for 7 years.  She grows coffee and bananas in large quantities.  What she most likes is being able to see her plantations growing without major problems, since bad weather can cause her huge losses.  However, in spite of this, Olga always acquits herself well thanks to the support that she receives from her community bank.  It means that she can invest more in strengthening her crops which she fertilizes constantly.  She sells every harvest to a well-known firm in the city of Villa Rica.  She is now thinking of investing in opening a diner in a space in her home that she has adapted for this purpose.  She is planning to sell hamburgers, cold drinks and sweet treats.

This is Olga's second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she feels fortunate for the constant success that she has achieved thanks to the support that she has received.  She will invest her loan in buying the materials she needs to open her diner.  If the money reaches far enough, she will also buy drinks and sweet treats.

loans.use: To buy materials for setting up a diner.  She will also buy drinks and sweet treats

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene la edad de 39 años, madre de tres hijos, es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado apoyar  a su familia atreves de su negocio.
Tiene una pequeña pulpería y palmea tortilla, negocio que inicio con dinero de su trabajo como costurera debido a que se le bajo su trabajo y no le estaba dando ingreso opto por palmear tortilla y su pequeña venta quien su esposo dio para que comenzara, quien trabaja como cadete de taxi.
Con este préstamo comprara varios quintales de maíz, maseca, leña para elevar la producción de tortilla.
Está contenta por esta nueva inversión a producir más tortillas, lo que espera lograr el objetivo y que gracias Afodenic hará posible.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old.  She has three children and is an enterprising woman who has managed to support her family through her business.

Carmen has a small grocery store and she hand-makes tortillas.  She started her business with money from her work as a dressmaker.  Her work went down and she wasn't making enough income, so she decided to make tortillas instead.  Her husband, who works as a taxi driver, helped her to start up her small store.

Carmen will use her loan to buy several 100kg sacks of corn, Maseca corn flour and firewood, to increase her tortilla production.

She is grateful for this new investment for making tortillas and she hopes that, thanks to Afodenic, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy several 100kg sacks of corn to produce more tortillas and make more profits

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 28 years old and married. The borrower graduated from primary school. The borrower will use this loan to develop his grocery shop by purchasing new tables to make more space to sell the fruit and the vegetables. The borrower has a high reputation in the markets. His fruit and vegetables are fresh every time and this is attracting the clients to purchase from him on a daily basis.

loans.use: To develop his grocery shop

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Armando es un padre de familia muy dedicado al trabajo para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios. Tiene la edad de 39 años, Trabaja como albañil desde hace veinte años pues ha sido su fuente de ingreso que logro aprender debido a la necesidad de falta de empleo.
Tiene el apoyo de su esposa ya que labora en servicios domésticos ya que ambos equilibran los gastos.
Como dificultad es que su trabajo no es fijo y que ha veces tiene semanas que no le salen trabajo, a si como le salen trabajos buenos en construcción  Lo que va hacer con este préstamo es la mejora del baño ya que tiene las puertas en mal estado lo que le urge solucionar y poder tener una mejor higiene y privacidad. 
Gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic, hará posible esta mejora a plazos el cual se beneficia ya que sus cuotas son mensuales y un costo accesibles a pagar
texts.en:
Armando is a father who is very committed to his work as he wants to help his children with their studies.  He is 39 years old and has worked as a construction worker for twenty years.  It has been his source of income.  He learned the trade because he needed to as he didn't have a job.

Armando has the support of his wife who works as a cleaner.  Together they balance their expenses.

The difficulty is that Armando's work is not regular.  There are times when he doesn't have any jobs for weeks and also times when good jobs come up.  What he would like to do with this loan is improve his bathroom because the doors are in a bad state.  This is something he must fix in order to have better hygiene and privacy.

Thanks to a loan from Afodenic, he will be able to make this improvement and pay in instalments.  This will benefit him as the instalments are monthly and affordable for him.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve his bathroom, achieving better hygiene and privacy

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 54 years old. The borrower graduated from intermediate school. The borrower is employed. She is living in an apartment on the second floor and always suffers from paying the rent. The borrower always thinks of having her own home and living comfortably and quietly. She will use this loan to complete her house and she will be able to gather the whole family in this house.  This loan will bring hope and happiness to the family.

loans.use: To purchase cement and tiles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 47 years old and married with four children. The borrower graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to develop his shop (which is used for repairing cars) and purchase some new equipment like a heavy jack, new sets of spanners and a welding machine. The borrower has a high reputation in the market and is capable of attracting lots of clients due to his good quality and reasonable fees.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his car repair shop

loans.name: Mauro Eleuterio

texts.es:
Mauro de 34 años, tiene una pequeña farmacia. Trabaja con su esposo desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo medicinas. Escogió esta actividad con ayuda de su padre hace 6 años atrás pero por la diferencias de ingresos él tuvo que separarse de su papa y conseguir un lugar para alquilar y tener sus propios ingresos y así poder mantener a su familia. 

 Con un pequeño capital que tenía comenzó a comprar medicinas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am con ayuda de su esposa vendiendo remedio como apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo etc. El tiene dos hijos de 14 y 10 años que estudian en un colegio fiscal y viven todos en una casa que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en una zona urbana llamada suburbio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo expectorante etc. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para que su esposa lo administre y seguir esforzándose para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mauro, age 34, has a small pharmacy. He works with his wife from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. selling medicines. He began in this business 6 years ago with help from his father, but because of disputes over money he had to separate himself from his father’s business and get a place to rent and to have his own income so that he would be able to support his family.

With the little capital that he had he began to purchase medicines. Currently, he works from 6:00 a.m. with his wife selling remedies such as apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo, etc. He has two children, ages 14 and 10, who study in a public school. They all live in a house that has all the basic services and is located in an urban area called Suburbio.

With the loan he wants to buy medicines such as meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo, expectorants, etc. In the future, he wants to have another business that his wife can run and to continue striving so that his children have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 36 years old, married and has four children. The borrower graduated from primary school and he is self-employed. The borrower will use this loan to complete building his house. The borrower and his family are living in a very small rented house. He wants to complete his house to live happily and comfortably with his family. The borrower will benefit a lot from this loan, as it will help him to complete his house quickly.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.en:
“Amigas Unidas” is a borrower group of friends and neighbors who live in the town of Chacracerro, very far north of Lima.  Jadee (in the red shirt in the first row) has been president of this group for more than a year.  She has two small children and is 30 years old.

Jadee runs a tailoring business out of her house.  She and her two siblings all work together to make custom clothing and alterations.  With this loan, Jadee plans to purchase a third sewing machine to increase the volume of her work.   Jadee hopes to someday have her own clothing store that sells her very own label.

Note- Extra person pictured:  The woman on the far right-hand siD. in the black jacket is not borrowing with this group currently, but she had in the past.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un hombre de 49 años de edad, que se ha dedicado a apoyar a su familia. Trabaja como cadete de taxi, el cual lleva varios años dando su servicio. Siendo su vehículo propio, comprándolo con ahorros y liquidación de su trabajo anterior como lector de medidores.
Con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros para mejorar el techo de su vivienda que le urge cambiar por el mal estado que esta.
Contento porque hará posible la mejora. Como planes es seguir haciendo las reparaciones de su casa ya que por este medio le es de beneficio por sus plazos.
texts.en:
Fidel is 49 years old.  He is committed to supporting his family.  He works as a taxi driver and has been providing his service for several years.  He owns his own vehicle, having bought it with his savings and severance pay from his previous job as a meter reader.

Fidel will use this loan to buy building materials such as sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams, bolts etc. to improve the roof of his house which must be changed because it is in a bad state.

Fidel is happy that he will be able to make this improvement.  His plan is to continue making repairs on his home.  This way of doing it is helpful for him because he can pay in instalments.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets, beams, bolts and other materials to improve the roof of his house

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 33 años, convive con Sergio, de 38 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Roxana, de 17 y Reiner de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Está emprendedora mujer, todas las mañanas se dedica a los cuidados de sus sembríos de café, plátanos, y palta. Ya tiene  5 años dedicándose a la agricultura, gracias al buen cuidado y dedicación que le brinda constantemente a sus cultivos, cada cosecha agrícola, obtienen buenos resultados, según menciona su granos de café, los comercializa en la asociación “Apsi”, que formaron los agricultores de su localidad, Pero sus demás frutos, los vende en la ciudad de Villa Rica, a donde viaja constantemente. Ahora Sonia, está pensando sembrar, más cantidad de café y mejorar su calidad, asimismo quiere surtir su tienda de comestibles con la compra de gaseosas, dulces, y productos de primera necesidad. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia, nueva de su banco comunal, se compromete a no defraudar la confianza y el apoyo que depositan en ella. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bolsas negras, para hacer su vivero de café, de la misma manera surtirá su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner, 38 year-old Sergio.  They have 2 children: 17 year-old Roxana and 7 year-old Reiner.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).  This enterprising woman spends every morning caring for her coffee, banana and avocado crops.  She has been farming for 5 years and, thanks to the good care and attention which she constantly gives her crops, she obtains good results with each harvest.  She mentions that she sells her coffee beans in the 'Aspi' association which the farmers in her town set up.  She sells her fruit in the city of Villa Rica which she travels to constantly.  Now Sonia is thinking of planting more coffee and improving its quality.  She would also like to stock her grocery store by purchasing soda, sweets and basic household products.

This is Sonia's second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she pledges not to let down the people who have placed trust in her and supported her.  She will use her loan to buy black bags for her coffee nursery.  She will also stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store and black bags for her coffee nursery

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María de 46 años, hace 13 años atrás comenzó con su negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto en la calle por motivación de su esposo ya que le encantaba la comida que ella preparaba en la casa. Con esfuerzo ubico su negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto en la calle y lo llama “El arbolito”. Trabaja con su esposo desde las 12h00 preparando la comida y repartiéndola hasta las 15h00 de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana trabajan en las noches. 

Cada almuerzo los vende a $ 1.60 esto incluye sopa, plato fuete, jugo. Los fines de semana  venden arroz con menestra con carne, pollo, chancho a $ 2.00 cada plato. Trabaja con ayuda de un empleado y su esposo que reparte la comida mientras que ella arma los platos. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos  en una zona urbana llamada suburbio lugar caracterizado porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas, carnes para hacer más platos. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito y ampliar el lugar.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old.  Thirteen years ago she started her business selling meals.  She was motivated by her husband since he loved the meals that she prepared at home.  Through hard work, she established her business selling meals from a street kiosk and called it “El arbolito” (Little Tree).  She works with her husband from 12.00pm to 3.00pm, preparing food and delivering it, from Monday to Friday.  On weekends they work evenings.

She sells each lunch for $1.60.  This includes soup, main meal and juice.  On weekends she sells rice with mixed vegetables and meat, chicken, pork, at $2.00 a dish.  She works with the help of an employee and her husband who delivers the meals while she makes them.  She lives with her husband and two children in an urban area.  The area is noted for the fact that most of its residents are informal salespeople.

María would like to use her loan to buy rice, oil, drinks and meat so that she can make more meals.  In the future, she would like her children to successfully complete their studies and to expand the premises.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and drinks

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely, de 49 años, está casada con José, de 54 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora ella vive sola con su esposo en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. En la localidad de San Pedro, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la artesanía, encontramos a Nely, una mujer emprendedora, que hace 20 años que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, mantas de lana, ponchos y demás tejidos a base de lana sintética y de algodón. Con el tiempo, dedicación y trabajo, logró abrir un puesto en la casa del artesano, que queda en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huancayo, punto de encuentro de los turistas que visitan el valle del Mantaro. Pero como mujer emprendedora ella, también tiene un carro, que hace trasporte público en las rutas de Tarma – Lima. Ahora Nely, está planeando viajar a diferentes ferias del país, donde puede expander su negocio. Esté es el primer crédito con MFP, y espera no defraudar el apoyo y confianza que le brinda su banco comunal, por ello se compromete en seguir adelante con los pagos puntuales. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de artesanía, para surtir su tienda en la ciudad de Huancayo.
texts.en:
Nely, 49, is married to  José, 54, and they have 3 adult children.  She now lives alone with her husband in their own house, located in the area of San Pedro de Cajas.  In this area of San Pedro, where most of the people work in handicrafts, we find Nely, an enterprising woman who has for the last 20 years worked making mats, wool capes, ponchos and other knit products using synthetic wool and cotton.
With time, dedication, and work, she has been able to open a stand in the “Casa del artesano” (Arts and crafts center) located in central Huancayo.  This is where many tourists come who visit the valley of Mantaro.
But since she's an entrepreneur, she also has a car which she uses to transport people on the route Tarma-Lima.  Now Nely is planning to travel to different markets in the country where she will be able to expand her business.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes not to disappoint the support and confidence offered her by the communal bank and that is why she promises to be punctual with the payments.  She will buy handicrafts to supply her store in the city of Huancayo with the loan.

loans.use: To buy handicraft items to supply her store

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 37 años, es una valerosa madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos: Leonardo, de 17 y Yamil, de 2 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de su hermano Leonidas, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Hace más de 17 años, que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, chompas, gorras y demás productos a base de lana; los hermosos tejidos con motivos diversos, los vende a los comerciantes que constantemente visita el lugar, pero en temporada de mayor venta los comercializa en la capital del país. Pero como buena mujer emprendedora, Olinda, también siembra papa y maca en grandes cantidades; los cuales vende a los compradores que visitan sus terrenos agrícolas constantemente. Ahora Olinda, desea invertir más en el desarrollo de sus negocios, por ello más adelante desea invertir en la adquisición de una tienda, donde puedan encontrar los hermosos tejidos de Olinda, asimismo poder comercializar sus sembríos. Esté es el primer crédito con MFP, y espera surgir con el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde asegura podrá salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará lana acrílica y de alpaca; donde invertirá un promedio de mil soles aproximadamente, y con el dinero que resta comprará artesanía ya hecha para revenderlos a los compradores que visitan la zona constantemente.
texts.en:
Olinda is a courageous 37-year-old single mother with two sons: Leonardo, age 17, and Yamil, age 2. She lives with her close-knit family in the house of her brother, Leonidas, in the San Pedro de Cajas area. For over 17 years now, she has worked making tapestries, sweaters, knit hats, and other items using wool. She makes these beautiful knit goods in a variety of patterns and sells them to the merchants who frequently visit the area. Additionally, she sometimes goes to the capital city in order to sell them in larger quantities. 

Olinda, diligent woman that she is, also grows large quantities of potatoes and maca plants. She sells these crops to the buyers who often come visit her farmland. Now Olinda would like to invest more in the development of her businesses. Eventually she hopes to put money towards the purchase of a store where she could sell her beautiful knit handicrafts and her crops as well.

This is her first MFP loan. She is hoping to make significant progress with the help of her village bank, which allows her to keep moving forward. She plans to use roughly 1,000 soles of the requested loan to buy acrylic and wool yarn. With the remaining funds, she plans to buy handicrafts in order to resell them to the buyers who often come through town.

loans.use: Purchase of acrylic and wool yarn and handicrafts

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
This borrower group’s name translates to “Strength and Union Towards the Future” and represents the optimism they feel about their possibilities.  Lizet (in the red vest) is the group’s president and has been borrowing with this group for three years.

Lizet is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  She recently began selling cosmetics in a display case in her mother’s store.  Lizet orders the cosmetics from catalogues and tries to only sell the most popular products.  With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory for the busy holiday season.   

In the future, Lizet would like to run her own beauty supply store and perhaps even become a hair stylist.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa H. C. es soltera y tiene una hija, La cliente se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva palmito, naranja, y por ultimo cuenta con cultivos menores, ella se dedica a trabajar junto a su madre que es una persona mayor de edad a la cual cuida es una persona responsable, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su madre y a su hija, es madre soltera el padre de su hijo la dejo hace más de un año es por eso que ella empezó a buscar el sustento de su hijo con el apoyo de su madre la cual le presta el terreno donde ella cultiva sus productos.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de Plantines de Cítricos, lo que le permitirá en un futuro cercano mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa H. C. is a single mother with one daughter. Our client works in the agricultural sector, growing palm hearts, oranges and other minor crops as well. She works with and takes care of her elderly mother. She is a responsible and hardworking person and an extremely dedicated daughter and mother. She is a single mother because the father of her child left her over a year ago. This is why she started looking for ways to support her child. She has been able to do this with the help of her mother, who lent her the land where she now grows her crops.

This is the first time our client has received a loan from our organization. With it, she will buy seeds for citrus plants. This will allow her to increase her income in the near future and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for citrus plants

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años, convive con Jesús, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Humberto, de 18 y Jasmira, de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Hace 5 años María abrió su tienda de venta de lanas, de diferentes colores, los cuales vende a los pobladores de su localidad, que se dedican al arte de tejer pendas de vestir, como también tapices. En su negocio le va muy bien, según menciona obtienen una ganancias neta de 300 soles semanales promedio.
